class  C2Vqq
 The NNLO matching function classes. In the implementation of these expressions I used the parameterization only for the regular part. The exact coefficicients of the rest are implemented explicitly as reported in appendix B.3 of https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.01473.pdf. More...

◆ verbosity

enum apfel::verbosity : int

Verbosity enumerator.

LOW = No informative and warning messages are displayed. Error messages are printed anyway. MEDIUM = No informative messages are displayed. Warning and error messages are printed. HIGH = All messages are displayed.

Enumerator
LOW 
MEDIUM 
HIGH

double const &  MuRef,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
int const &  nsteps = 10 
)

The BuildDglap, builds the dglap object.

Parameters
DglapObjstructure with the coeffs. of perturbative objects
InDistFuncthe PDF method to query flavors
MuRefthe reference scale
PerturbativeOrderthe perturbative order
Alphasthe alpha strong object
nstepsthe number of steps for RK.
Returns

Definition at line 854 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

860  {
861  // Collect thresholds.
862  vector<double> Thresholds;
863  for (auto const& obj : DglapObj)
864  {
865  const int nf = obj.first;
866  const double thr = obj.second.Threshold;
867  if ((int) Thresholds.size() < nf)
868  Thresholds.resize(nf);
869  Thresholds[nf-1] = thr;
870  }
871 
872  // Create set of initial distributions.
873  const Set<Distribution> InPDFs{DglapObj.at(NF(MuRef, Thresholds)).SplittingFunctions.at(0).GetMap(),
874  DistributionMap(DglapObj.begin()->second.SplittingFunctions.at(0).at(0).GetGrid(), InDistFunc, MuRef)};
875 
876  // Initialize DGLAP evolution.
877  return unique_ptr<Dglap<Distribution>>(new Dglap<Distribution>{SplittingFunctions(DglapObj, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas),
878  MatchingConditions(DglapObj, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas), InPDFs, MuRef, Thresholds, nsteps});
879  }

◆ BuildDglap() [2/3]

unique_ptr< Dglap< Operator > > apfel::BuildDglap ( map< int, DglapObjects > const &  DglapObj,
double const &  MuRef,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
int const &  nsteps 
)

Same as above but it computes the evolution of the evolution operators.

Definition at line 882 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

887  {
888  // Collect thresholds.
889  vector<double> Thresholds;
890  for (auto const& obj : DglapObj)
891  {
892  const int nf = obj.first;
893  const double thr = obj.second.Threshold;
894  if ((int) Thresholds.size() < nf)
895  Thresholds.resize(nf);
896  Thresholds[nf-1] = thr;
897  }
898 
899  // Allocate Identity and Zero operators.
900  const Operator One{DglapObj.begin()->second.SplittingFunctions.at(0).at(0).GetGrid(), Identity{}};
901  const Operator Zero{DglapObj.begin()->second.SplittingFunctions.at(0).at(0).GetGrid(), Null{}};
902 
903  // Create set of initial operators that represent the unity set of
904  // operators.
905  map<int,Operator> MapUnity;
906  MapUnity.insert({0, One});
907  MapUnity.insert({1, Zero});
908  MapUnity.insert({2, Zero});
909  MapUnity.insert({3, One});
910  MapUnity.insert({4, One});
911  MapUnity.insert({5, One});
912  MapUnity.insert({6, Zero});
913  MapUnity.insert({7, One});
914  MapUnity.insert({8, One});
915  MapUnity.insert({9, Zero});
916  MapUnity.insert({10, One});
917  MapUnity.insert({11, One});
918  MapUnity.insert({12, Zero});
919  MapUnity.insert({13, One});
920  MapUnity.insert({14, One});
921  MapUnity.insert({15, Zero});
922  MapUnity.insert({16, One});
923  MapUnity.insert({17, One});
924  MapUnity.insert({18, Zero});
925  MapUnity.insert({19, One});
926  Set<Operator> Unity{DglapObj.at(NF(MuRef, Thresholds)).SplittingFunctions.at(0).GetMap(), MapUnity};
927 
928  // Initialize DGLAP evolution.
929  return unique_ptr<Dglap<Operator>>(new Dglap<Operator>{SplittingFunctions(DglapObj, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas),
930  MatchingConditions(DglapObj, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas), Unity, MuRef, Thresholds, nsteps});
931  }

◆ BuildDglap() [3/3]

unique_ptr< Dglap< Distribution > > apfel::BuildDglap ( function< DglapObjects(double const &)> const &  DglapObj,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
function< map< int, double >(double const &, double const &)> const &  InDistFunc,
double const &  MuRef,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
int const &  nsteps 
)

Same as above but the DglapObjects object is a function of a variable. This is useful for applications in which the splitting functions depend on same energy scale.

Definition at line 934 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

941  {
942  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
943  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
944  // vector entries are ordered).
945  int nfi = 0;
946  int nff = Thresholds.size();
947  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
948  if (v <= 0)
949  nfi++;
950 
951  // Compute coupling above and below the thresholds.
952  map<int,double> asThUp;
953  map<int,double> asThDown;
954  for (int nf = nfi + 1; nf <= nff; nf++)
955  {
956  asThDown.insert({nf,Alphas(Thresholds[nf-1]*(1-eps8))/FourPi});
957  asThUp.insert({nf,Alphas(Thresholds[nf-1]*(1+eps8))/FourPi});
958  }
959 
960  // Create splitting functions and matching conditions lambda
961  // functions according to the requested perturbative order.
962  function<Set<Operator>(int const&, double const&)> SplittingFunctions;
963  function<Set<Operator>(bool const&, int const&)> MatchingConditions;
964  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
965  {
966  SplittingFunctions = [=] (int const&, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
967  {
968  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
969  return cp * DglapObj(mu).SplittingFunctions.at(0);
970  };
971  MatchingConditions = [=] (bool const&, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
972  {
973  return DglapObj(Thresholds[nf-1]).MatchingConditions.at(0);
974  };
975  }
976  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
977  {
978  SplittingFunctions = [=] (int const&, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
979  {
980  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
981  const auto sf = DglapObj(mu).SplittingFunctions;
982  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * sf.at(1) );
983  };
984  MatchingConditions = [=] (bool const&, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
985  {
986  return DglapObj(Thresholds[nf-1]).MatchingConditions.at(0);
987  };
988  }
989  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
990  {
991  SplittingFunctions = [=] (int const&, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
992  {
993  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
994  const auto sf = DglapObj(mu).SplittingFunctions;
995  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * ( sf.at(1) + cp * sf.at(2) ) );
996  };
997  MatchingConditions = [=] (bool const& Up, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
998  {
999  const double cp = asThUp.at(nf+1);
1000  const auto mc = DglapObj(Thresholds[nf-1]).MatchingConditions;
1001  return mc.at(0) + ( Up ? 1 : -1) * cp * cp * mc.at(2);
1002  };
1003  }
1004  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 3)
1005  {
1006  SplittingFunctions = [=] (int const&, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
1007  {
1008  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
1009  const auto sf = DglapObj(mu).SplittingFunctions;
1010  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * ( sf.at(1) + cp * ( sf.at(2) + cp * sf.at(3) ) ) );
1011  };
1012  MatchingConditions = [=] (bool const& Up, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
1013  {
1014  const double cp = asThUp.at(nf+1);
1015  const auto mc = DglapObj(Thresholds[nf-1]).MatchingConditions;
1016  return mc.at(0) + ( Up ? 1 : -1) * cp * cp * mc.at(2);
1017  };
1018  }
1019 
1020  // Create set of initial distributions.
1021  const Set<Distribution> InPDFs{DglapObj(MuRef).SplittingFunctions.at(0).GetMap(),
1022  DistributionMap(DglapObj(MuRef).SplittingFunctions.at(0).at(0).GetGrid(), InDistFunc, MuRef)};
1023 
1024  // Initialize DGLAP evolution.
1025  return unique_ptr<Dglap<Distribution>>(new Dglap<Distribution>{SplittingFunctions, MatchingConditions, InPDFs, MuRef, Thresholds, nsteps});
1026  }

◆ BuildStructureFunctions() [1/2]

map< int, Observable > apfel::BuildStructureFunctions ( function< StructureFunctionObjects(double const &, vector< double > const &)> const &  FObj,
function< map< int, double >(double const &, double const &)> const &  InDistFunc,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
function< vector< double >(double const &)> const &  Couplings 
)

The StructureFunctionBuildNC class constructs a map of "Observable" objects. As compared to the functions above, this takes as an input a function of Q as StructureFunctionObjects. This is needed for th massive structure functions.

Definition at line 1345 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

1350  {
1351  // Call FObj at energy 1 to use it for those quantities that do
1352  // not depend on Q.
1353  const StructureFunctionObjects FObj1 = FObj(1, Couplings(1));
1354 
1355  // Get grid.
1356  Grid const& g = FObj1.C0.at(1).at(0).GetGrid();
1357 
1358  // Get skip vector.
1359  const vector<int> skip = FObj1.skip;
1360 
1361  // Cycle over the key of the convolution basis map.
1362  map<int,Observable> F;
1363  for (auto it = FObj1.ConvBasis.begin(); it != FObj1.ConvBasis.end(); ++it)
1364  {
1365  // Structure function index.
1366  const int k = it->first;
1367  // Define coefficient function functions.
1368  const auto Cf = [=] (double const& Q) -> Set<Operator>
1369  {
1370  const double cp = Alphas(Q) / FourPi;
1371  const StructureFunctionObjects FObjQ = FObj(Q,Couplings(Q));
1372  Set<Operator> CoefFuncs = FObjQ.C0.at(k);
1373  if (PerturbativeOrder > 0)
1374  CoefFuncs += cp * FObjQ.C1.at(k);
1375  if (PerturbativeOrder > 1)
1376  CoefFuncs += cp * cp * FObjQ.C2.at(k);
1377  return CoefFuncs;
1378  };
1379 
1380  // Define distribution function functions.
1381  const auto DistF = [=,&g] (double const& Q) -> Set<Distribution>
1382  {
1383  return Set<Distribution>{FObj(Q,Couplings(Q)).ConvBasis.at(k), DistributionMap(g, InDistFunc, Q, skip)};
1384  };
1385 
1386  // Initialize "Observable".
1387  F.insert({k,Observable{Cf, DistF}});
1388  }
1389  return F;
1390  }

)

Function that returns the matched and evolved TMD FFs in b-space as functions of the final scale and rapidity zeta. It assumes the zeta-prescription.

Definition at line 248 of file tmdbuilder.cc.

257  {
258  // Computed TMDs at the initial scale by convoluting FFs,
259  // matching functions, and non-perturbative function.
260  const auto MatchedTmdFFs = MatchTmdFFs(TmdObj, DglapObj, CollFFs, Mub, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas);
261 
262  // Compute TMD evolution factors.
263  const auto EvolFactors = EvolutionFactors(TmdObj, Mu0b, Mub, PerturbativeOrder, Alphas, IntEps);
264 
265  // Construct the function that returns the product and includes
266  // the non perturbative function. Include a factor 1/z^2 typical
267  // of FFs.
268  const auto EvolvedTMDs = [=] (double const& b, double const& muf, double const& zetaf) -> Set<Distribution>
269  {
270  return EvolFactors(b, muf, zetaf) * ( [&] (double const& z) -> double{ return fNP(z, b); } * MatchedTmdFFs(b) );
271  };
272 
273  return EvolvedTMDs;
274  }

◆ dilog()

double apfel::dilog ( double const &  x)

Real dilogarithm .

Parameters
xreal argument
Note
Implementation translated by R.Brun from CERNLIB DILOG function C332
Returns

Definition at line 16 of file specialfunctions.cc.

17  {
18  const double PI = M_PI;
19  const double HF = 0.5;
20  const double PI2 = PI * PI;
21  const double PI3 = PI2 / 3;
22  const double PI6 = PI2 / 6;
23  const double PI12 = PI2 / 12;
24  const double C[20] = { 0.42996693560813697,
25  0.40975987533077105,
26  -0.01858843665014592,
27  0.00145751084062268,
28  -0.00014304184442340,
29  0.00001588415541880,
30  -0.00000190784959387,
31  0.00000024195180854,
32  -0.00000003193341274,
33  0.00000000434545063,
34  -0.00000000060578480,
35  0.00000000008612098,
36  -0.00000000001244332,
37  0.00000000000182256,
38  -0.00000000000027007,
39  0.00000000000004042,
40  -0.00000000000000610,
41  0.00000000000000093,
42  -0.00000000000000014,
43  0.00000000000000002};
44 
45  double T, H, Y, S, A, ALFA, B1, B2, B0;
46 
47  if (x == 1) {
48  H = PI6;
49  } else if (x == -1) {
50  H = -PI12;
51  } else {
52  T = -x;
53  if (T <= -2) {
54  Y = -1/(1+T);
55  S = 1;
56  B1= log(-T);
57  B2= log(1+1/T);
58  A = -PI3+HF*(B1*B1-B2*B2);
59  } else if (T < -1) {
60  Y = -1-T;
61  S = -1;
62  A = log(-T);
63  A = -PI6+A*(A+log(1+1/T));
64  } else if (T <= -0.5) {
65  Y = -(1+T)/T;
66  S = 1;
67  A = log(-T);
68  A = -PI6+A*(-HF*A+log(1+T));
69  } else if (T < 0) {
70  Y = -T/(1+T);
71  S = -1;
72  B1= log(1+T);
73  A = HF*B1*B1;
74  } else if (T <= 1) {
75  Y = T;
76  S = 1;
77  A = 0;
78  } else {
79  Y = 1/T;
80  S = -1;
81  B1= log(T);
82  A = PI6+HF*B1*B1;
83  }
84  H = Y+Y-1;
85  ALFA = H+H;
86  B1 = 0;
87  B2 = 0;
88  for (int i=19;i>=0;i--){
89  B0 = C[i] + ALFA*B1-B2;
90  B2 = B1;
91  B1 = B0;
92  }
93  H = -(S*(B0-H*B2)+A);
94  }
95  return H;
96  }

◆ DistributionMap() [1/2]

map< int, Distribution > apfel::DistributionMap ( Grid const &  g,
function< map< int, double >(double const &, double const &)> const &  InDistFunc,
double const &  Q,
vector< int > const &  skip 
)

Definition at line 298 of file distribution.cc.

302  {
303  // Joint grid and subgrid vectors.
304  const vector<double> jg = g.GetJointGrid().GetGrid();
305 
306  // Initialise output.
307  map<int,Distribution> DistMap;
308  const map<int,double> f = InDistFunc(jg[0],Q);
309  for (auto it = f.begin(); it != f.end(); ++it)
310  if (find(skip.begin(), skip.end(), it->first) == skip.end())
311  DistMap.insert({it->first,Distribution{g}});
312 
313  // Fill in joint grid.
314  for (auto const& ix : jg)
315  {
316  const map<int,double> f = InDistFunc(ix < 1 ? ix : 1,Q);
317  for (auto it = f.begin(); it != f.end(); ++it)
318  if (find(skip.begin(), skip.end(), it->first) == skip.end())
319  DistMap.at(it->first).PushJointGrid(it->second);
320  }
321 
322  // Fill in subgrids.
323  for (int ig = 0; ig < g.nGrids(); ig++)
324  {
325  bool next = true;
326  for (auto const& ix: g.GetSubGrid(ig).GetGrid())
327  {
328  const map<int,double> f = InDistFunc(ix < 1 ? ix : 1,Q);
329  for (auto it = f.begin(); it != f.end(); ++it)
330  if (find(skip.begin(), skip.end(), it->first) == skip.end())
331  DistMap.at(it->first).PushSubGrid(it->second, next);
332  next = false;
333  }
334  }
335 
336  return DistMap;
337  }

351  if (find(skip.begin(), skip.end(), it->first) == skip.end())
352  DistMap.insert({it->first,Distribution{g}});
353

355  for (auto const& ix : jg)

◆ EvolutionFactors()

function< vector< double >double const &, double const &, double const &)> apfel::EvolutionFactors ( map< int, TmdObjects > const &  TmdObj,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Mu0b,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Mub,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Function that returns the TMD evolution factor as a function of the impact factor, the final scale and rapidity.

Definition at line 497 of file tmdbuilder.cc.

503  {
504  // Retrieve thresholds from "TmdObj".
505  vector<double> thrs;
506  for(auto const& obj : TmdObj)
507  {
508  const int nf = obj.first;
509  const double thr = obj.second.Threshold;
510  if ((int) thrs.size() < nf)
511  thrs.resize(nf);
512  thrs[nf-1] = thr;
513  }
514 
515  // Define the LX fuction as in eq. (4.9) of arXiv:1604.07869.
516  const double C0 = 2 * exp(- emc);
517  const auto LX = [C0] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double{ return 2 * log( b * mu / C0 ); };
518 
519  // Create functions needed for the TMD evolution.
520  function<double(double const&)> gammaVq;
521  function<double(double const&)> gammaVg;
522  function<double(double const&)> GammaCuspq;
523  function<double(double const&)> GammaCuspg;
524  function<double(double const&, double const&)> DCSq;
525  function<double(double const&, double const&)> DCSg;
526  function<double(double const&, double const&)> zetaq;
527  function<double(double const&, double const&)> zetag;
528  // LL
529  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
530  {
531  gammaVq = [=] (double const&) -> double{ return 0; };
532  gammaVg = [=] (double const&) -> double{ return 0; };
533  GammaCuspq = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
534  {
535  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
536  return coup * TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspq.at(0);
537  };
538  GammaCuspg = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
539  {
540  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
541  return coup * TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspg.at(0);
542  };
543  DCSq = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
544  {
545  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdq;
546  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
547  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
548  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
549  return coup * lo;
550  };
551  DCSg = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
552  {
553  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdg;
554  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
555  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
556  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
557  return coup * lo;
558  };
559  zetaq = [=] (double const& mu, double const&) -> double{ return mu * mu; };
560  zetag = [=] (double const& mu, double const&) -> double{ return mu * mu; };
561  }
562  // NLL
563  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
564  {
565  gammaVq = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
566  {
567  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
568  return coup * TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaVq.at(0);
569  };
570  gammaVg = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
571  {
572  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
573  return coup * TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaVg.at(0);
574  };
575  GammaCuspq = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
576  {
577  const auto gc = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspq;
578  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
579  return coup * ( gc.at(0) + coup * gc.at(1) );
580  };
581  GammaCuspg = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
582  {
583  const auto gc = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspg;
584  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
585  return coup * ( gc.at(0) + coup * gc.at(1) );
586  };
587  DCSq = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
588  {
589  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdq;
590  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
591  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
592  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
593  const double nlo = d.at(1)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(1)[1] + Lmu * d.at(1)[2] );
594  return coup * ( lo + coup * nlo );
595  };
596  DCSg = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
597  {
598  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdg;
599  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
600  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
601  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
602  const double nlo = d.at(1)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(1)[1] + Lmu * d.at(1)[2] );
603  return coup * ( lo + coup * nlo );
604  };
605  zetaq = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
606  {
607  const auto lz = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).Lzetaq;
608  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
609  const double lo = lz.at(0)[0] + Lmu * lz.at(0)[1];
610  const double lzeta = lo;
611  return 4 * exp( - lzeta + Lmu - 2 * emc ) / b / b;
612  };
613  zetag = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
614  {
615  const auto lz = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).Lzetag;
616  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
617  const double lo = lz.at(0)[0] + Lmu * lz.at(0)[1];
618  const double lzeta = lo;
619  return 4 * exp( - lzeta + Lmu - 2 * emc ) / b / b;
620  };
621  }
622  // NNLL
623  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
624  {
625  gammaVq = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
626  {
627  const auto gv = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaVq;
628  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
629  return coup * ( gv.at(0) + coup * gv.at(1) );
630  };
631  gammaVg = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
632  {
633  const auto gv = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaVg;
634  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
635  return coup * ( gv.at(0) + coup * gv.at(1) );
636  };
637  GammaCuspq = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
638  {
639  const auto gc = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspq;
640  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
641  return coup * ( gc.at(0) + coup * ( gc.at(1) + coup * gc.at(2) ) );
642  };
643  GammaCuspg = [=] (double const& mu) -> double
644  {
645  const auto gc = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).GammaCuspg;
646  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
647  return coup * ( gc.at(0) + coup * ( gc.at(1) + coup * gc.at(2) ) );
648  };
649  DCSq = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
650  {
651  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdq;
652  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
653  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
654  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
655  const double nlo = d.at(1)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(1)[1] + Lmu * d.at(1)[2] );
656  const double nnlo = d.at(2)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(2)[1] + Lmu * ( d.at(2)[2] + Lmu * d.at(2)[3] ) );
657  return coup * ( lo + coup * ( nlo + coup * nnlo ) );
658  };
659  DCSg = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
660  {
661  const auto d = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).CSdg;
662  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
663  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
664  const double lo = d.at(0)[0] + Lmu * d.at(0)[1];
665  const double nlo = d.at(1)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(1)[1] + Lmu * d.at(1)[2] );
666  const double nnlo = d.at(2)[0] + Lmu * ( d.at(2)[1] + Lmu * ( d.at(2)[2] + Lmu * d.at(2)[3] ) );
667  return coup * ( lo + coup * ( nlo + coup * nnlo ) );
668  };
669  zetaq = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
670  {
671  const auto lz = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).Lzetaq;
672  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
673  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
674  const double lo = lz.at(0)[0] + Lmu * lz.at(0)[1];
675  const double nlo = lz.at(1)[0] + Lmu * Lmu * lz.at(1)[2];
676  const double lzeta = lo + coup * nlo;
677  return 4 * exp( - lzeta + Lmu - 2 * emc ) / b / b;
678  };
679  zetag = [=] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double
680  {
681  const auto lz = TmdObj.at(NF(mu,thrs)).Lzetag;
682  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
683  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
684  const double lo = lz.at(0)[0] + Lmu * lz.at(0)[1];
685  const double nlo = lz.at(1)[0] + Lmu * Lmu * lz.at(1)[2];
686  const double lzeta = lo + coup * nlo;
687  return 4 * exp( - lzeta + Lmu - 2 * emc ) / b / b;
688  };
689  }
690 
691  // Define the integrands.
692  Integrator I1q{[=] (double const& mu) -> double{ return ( - gammaVq(mu) + 2 * log(mu) * GammaCuspq(mu) ) / mu; }};
693  Integrator I1g{[=] (double const& mu) -> double{ return ( - gammaVg(mu) + 2 * log(mu) * GammaCuspg(mu) ) / mu; }};
694  Integrator I2q{[=] (double const& mu) -> double{ return GammaCuspq(mu) / mu; }};
695  Integrator I2g{[=] (double const& mu) -> double{ return GammaCuspg(mu) / mu; }};
696 
697  // Construct function that returns the product of: matching
698  // functions, PDFs, NP function, and evolution factors, i.e. the
699  // set of evolved TMDs (times x).
700  const auto EvolFactors = [=] (double const& b, double const& muf, double const& zetaf) -> vector<double>
701  {
702  // Define relevant scales
703  const double mu0 = Mu0b(b);
704  const double mui = Mub(b);
705  const double zetaiq = zetaq(mui,b);
706  const double zetaig = zetag(mui,b);
707 
708  // Compute argument of the exponent of the evolution factors.
709  const double LRq = I1q.integrate(mui, muf, thrs, IntEps)
710  - I2q.integrate(mu0, muf, thrs, IntEps) * log(zetaf)
711  + I2q.integrate(mu0, mui, thrs, IntEps) * log(zetaiq);
712  const double LRg = I1g.integrate(mui, muf, thrs, IntEps)
713  - I2g.integrate(mu0, muf, thrs, IntEps) * log(zetaf)
714  + I2g.integrate(mu0, mui, thrs, IntEps) * log(zetaig);
715 
716  // Compute the evolution factors.
717  const double Rq = exp( LRq - DCSq(mu0,b) * log( zetaf / zetaiq ) );
718  const double Rg = exp( LRg - DCSg(mu0,b) * log( zetaf / zetaig ) );
719 
720  // Return vector of evolution factors.
721  return vector<double>{Rg, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq, Rq};
722  };
723 
724  return EvolFactors;
725  }
apfel::FourPi

◆ HardCrossSectionDY()

double apfel::HardCrossSectionDY ( int const &  pt,
double const &  Alphas,
int const &  nf,
double const &  kappa 
)

Perturbative hard cross section for Drell-Yann.

Definition at line 263 of file tmdcrosssections.cc.

264  {
265  // Compute log anf its powers.
266  const double lQ2 = 2 * log(kappa);
267  const double lQ22 = lQ2 * lQ2;
268  const double lQ23 = lQ22 * lQ2;
269  const double lQ24 = lQ23 * lQ2;
270 
271  // Compute coupling and its powers.
272  const double as = Alphas / FourPi;
273  const double as2 = as * as;
274 
275  // Now compute hard cross section according to the perturbative
276  // order.
277  double hxs = 1;
278  if (pt > 0)
279  hxs += 2 * as * CF * ( - lQ22 - 3 * lQ2 - 8 + 7 * Pi2 / 6 );
280  if (pt > 1)
281  hxs += 2 * as2 * CF *
282  ( CF * ( lQ24 + 6 * lQ23 + ( 25. - 7 * Pi2 / 3 ) * lQ22 + ( 93. / 2. - 5 * Pi2 - 24 * zeta3 ) * lQ2
283  + 511. / 8. - 83 * Pi2 / 6 - 30 * zeta3 + 67 * Pi2 * Pi2 / 60 ) +
284  CA * ( - 11 * lQ23 / 9 + ( - 233. / 18. + Pi2 / 3 ) * lQ22 + ( - 2545. / 54. + 22 * Pi2 / 9 + 26 * zeta3 ) * lQ2
285  - 51157. / 648. + 1061 * Pi2 / 108 + 313 * zeta3 / 9 - 4 * Pi2 * Pi2 / 45 ) +
286  TR * nf * ( 4 * lQ23 / 9 + 38 * lQ22 / 9 + ( 418. / 27. - 8 * Pi2 / 9 ) * lQ2
287  + 4085. / 162. - 91 * Pi2 / 27 + 4 * zeta3 / 9 ) );
288 
289  return hxs;
290  };

QCD colour factor (i.e. SU(3)).

◆ HardCrossSectionSIDIS()

double apfel::HardCrossSectionSIDIS ( int const &  pt,
double const &  Alphas,
int const &  nf,
double const &  kappa 
)

Perturbative hard cross section for SIDIS.

Definition at line 293 of file tmdcrosssections.cc.

294  {
295  // Compute log anf its powers.
296  const double lQ2 = 2 * log(kappa);
297  const double lQ22 = lQ2 * lQ2;
298  const double lQ23 = lQ22 * lQ2;
299  const double lQ24 = lQ23 * lQ2;
300 
301  // Compute coupling and its powers.
302  const double as = Alphas / FourPi;
303  const double as2 = as * as;
304 
305  // Now compute hard cross section according to the perturbative
306  // order.
307  double hxs = 1;
308  if (pt > 0)
309  hxs += 2 * as * CF * ( - lQ22 - 3 * lQ2 - 8 + zeta2 );
310  if (pt > 1)
311  hxs += 2 * as2 * CF *
312  ( CF * ( lQ24 + 6 * lQ23 + ( 25. - 2 * zeta2 ) * lQ22 + ( 93. / 2. + 6 * zeta2 - 24 * zeta3 ) * lQ2
313  + 511. / 8. + 13 * zeta2 - 30 * zeta3 + 39 * zeta4 / 2 ) +
314  CA * ( - 11 * lQ23 / 9 + ( - 233. / 18. + 2 * zeta2 ) * lQ22 + ( - 2545. / 54. - 22 * zeta2 / 3 + 26 * zeta3 ) * lQ2
315  - 51157. / 648. - 337 * zeta2 / 18 + 313 * zeta3 / 9 + 22 * zeta4 ) +
316  TR * nf * ( 4 * lQ23 / 9 + 38 * lQ22 / 9 + ( 418. / 27. + 8 * zeta2 / 3 ) * lQ2
317  + 4085. / 162. + 46 * zeta2 / 9 + 4 * zeta3 / 9 ) );
318 
319  return hxs;
320  };

◆ InitializeDglapObjectsQCD() [1/2]

map< int, DglapObjects > apfel::InitializeDglapObjectsQCD ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
bool const &  OpEvol = false,
double const &  IntEps = 1e-5 
)

The InitializeDglapObjectsQCD, precompute the perturbative coefficients of space-like unpolarised splitting functions and matching conditions and store them in the 'DglapObjects' structure.

Parameters
gthe grid
IntEpsthe integration accuracy
Masses
Thresholds
Returns

Definition at line 26 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

31  {
32  report("Initializing DglapObjects for space-like QCD unpolarised evolution... ");
33  Timer t;
34 
35  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
36  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
37  // vector entries are ordered).
38  int nfi = 0;
39  int nff = Thresholds.size();
40  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
41  if (v <= 0)
42  nfi++;
43 
44  // Compute logs of muth2 / m2 needed for the the matching
45  // conditions.
46  vector<double> LogKth;
47  for (int im = 0; im < (int) Thresholds.size(); im++)
48  if (Thresholds[im] < eps12 || Masses[im] < eps12)
49  LogKth.push_back(0);
50  else
51  LogKth.push_back(2 * log( Thresholds[im] / Masses[im] ));
52 
53  // Allocate needed operators (matching conditions and splitting
54  // functions). By now the code is fast enough to precompute
55  // everything at all available perturbative orders and the current
56  // perturbative order is accounted for only when the actual
57  // splitting functions and matching conditions (lambda) functions
58  // are defined.
59  // ===============================================================
60  // LO Matching conditions.
61  map<int,Operator> MatchLO;
62  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
63  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
64  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Id});
65  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Id});
66  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
67  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
68  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, Id});
69  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
70  MatchLO.insert({i, Id});
71  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
72  MatchLO.insert({i, Zero});
73 
74  // ===============================================================
75  // LO splitting function operators.
76  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapLO;
77  const Operator O0ns{g, P0ns{}, IntEps};
78  const Operator O0qg{g, P0qg{}, IntEps};
79  const Operator O0gq{g, P0gq{}, IntEps};
80  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
81  {
82  const Operator O0gg{g, P0gg{nf}, IntEps};
83  const Operator O0qgnf = nf * O0qg;
84  map<int,Operator> OM;
85  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O0ns});
86  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O0ns});
87  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O0ns});
88  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O0ns});
89  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O0qgnf});
90  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O0gq});
91  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O0gg});
92  OpMapLO.insert({nf, OM});
93  }
94 
95  // ===============================================================
96  // NLO Matching conditions.
97  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchNLO;
98  const Operator AS1HgL {g, AS1Hg_L{}, IntEps};
99  const Operator AS1ggHL{g, AS1ggH_L{}, IntEps};
100  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
101  {
102  const Operator AS1Hg = LogKth[nf] * AS1HgL;
103  const Operator AS1ggH = LogKth[nf] * AS1ggHL;
104  const Operator AS1Tg = - nf * AS1Hg;
105  map<int,Operator> OM;
106  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Zero});
107  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Zero});
108  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, AS1Hg});
109  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
110  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, AS1ggH});
111  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
112  OM.insert({i, Zero});
113  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
114  if (i > MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
115  OM.insert({i, AS1Hg});
116  else if (i == MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
117  OM.insert({i, AS1Tg});
118  else
119  OM.insert({i, Zero});
120  MatchNLO.insert({nf, OM});
121  }
122 
123  // ===============================================================
124  // NLO splitting function operators.
125  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNLO;
126  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
127  {
128  const Operator O1nsp{g, P1nsp{nf}, IntEps};
129  const Operator O1nsm{g, P1nsm{nf}, IntEps};
130  const Operator O1ps {g, P1ps{nf}, IntEps};
131  const Operator O1qg {g, P1qg{nf}, IntEps};
132  const Operator O1gq {g, P1gq{nf}, IntEps};
133  const Operator O1gg {g, P1gg{nf}, IntEps};
134  const Operator O1qq = O1nsp + O1ps;
135  map<int,Operator> OM;
136  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1nsp});
137  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1nsm});
138  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1nsm});
139  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1qq});
140  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O1qg});
141  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O1gq});
142  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O1gg});
143  OpMapNLO.insert({nf, OM});
144  }
145 
146  // ===============================================================
147  // NNLO Matching conditions.
148  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchNNLO;
149  const Operator APS2Hq0 {g, APS2Hq_0{}, IntEps};
150  const Operator APS2HqL {g, APS2Hq_L{}, IntEps};
151  const Operator APS2HqL2 {g, APS2Hq_L2{}, IntEps};
152  const Operator ANS2qqH0 {g, ANS2qqH_0{}, IntEps};
153  const Operator ANS2qqHL {g, ANS2qqH_L{}, IntEps};
154  const Operator ANS2qqHL2{g, ANS2qqH_L2{}, IntEps};
155  const Operator AS2Hg0 {g, AS2Hg_0{}, IntEps};
156  const Operator AS2HgL {g, AS2Hg_L{}, IntEps};
157  const Operator AS2HgL2 {g, AS2Hg_L2{}, IntEps};
158  const Operator AS2gqH0 {g, AS2gqH_0{}, IntEps};
159  const Operator AS2gqHL {g, AS2gqH_L{}, IntEps};
160  const Operator AS2gqHL2 {g, AS2gqH_L2{}, IntEps};
161  const Operator AS2ggH0 {g, AS2ggH_0{}, IntEps};
162  const Operator AS2ggHL {g, AS2ggH_L{}, IntEps};
163  const Operator AS2ggHL2 {g, AS2ggH_L2{}, IntEps};
164  const Operator AS2qqH0 = ANS2qqH0 + APS2Hq0;
165  const Operator AS2qqHL = ANS2qqHL + APS2HqL;
166  const Operator AS2qqHL2 = ANS2qqHL2 + APS2HqL2;
167  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
168  {
169  const double lnk = LogKth[nf];
170  const double lnk2 = lnk * lnk;
171  const Operator APS2Hq = APS2Hq0 + lnk * APS2HqL + lnk2 * APS2HqL2;
172  const Operator ANS2qqH = ANS2qqH0 + lnk * ANS2qqHL + lnk2 * ANS2qqHL2;
173  const Operator AS2Hg = AS2Hg0 + lnk * AS2HgL + lnk2 * AS2HgL2;
174  const Operator AS2gqH = AS2gqH0 + lnk * AS2gqHL + lnk2 * AS2gqHL2;
175  const Operator AS2ggH = AS2ggH0 + lnk * AS2ggHL + lnk2 * AS2ggHL2;
176  const Operator AS2qqH = AS2qqH0 + lnk * AS2qqHL + lnk2 * AS2qqHL2;
177  const Operator AS2TqH = ANS2qqH - nf * APS2Hq;
178  const Operator AS2Tg = - nf * AS2Hg;
179  map<int,Operator> OM;
180  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, ANS2qqH});
181  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, AS2qqH});
182  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, AS2Hg});
183  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, AS2gqH});
184  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, AS2ggH});
185  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
186  if (i > MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q + nf - 1)
187  OM.insert({i, AS2qqH});
188  else if (i == MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q + nf - 1)
189  OM.insert({i, AS2TqH});
190  else
191  OM.insert({i, ANS2qqH});
192  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
193  if (i > MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
194  OM.insert({i, AS2Hg});
195  else if (i == MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
196  OM.insert({i, AS2Tg});
197  else
198  OM.insert({i, Zero});
199  MatchNNLO.insert({nf, OM});
200  }
201 
202  // ===============================================================
203  // NNLO splitting function operators.
204  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNNLO;
205  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
206  {
207  const Operator O2nsp{g, P2nsp{nf}, IntEps};
208  const Operator O2nsm{g, P2nsm{nf}, IntEps};
209  const Operator O2nss{g, P2nss{nf}, IntEps};
210  const Operator O2ps {g, P2ps{nf}, IntEps};
211  const Operator O2qg {g, P2qg{nf}, IntEps};
212  const Operator O2gq {g, P2gq{nf}, IntEps};
213  const Operator O2gg {g, P2gg{nf}, IntEps};
214  const Operator O2qq = O2nsp + O2ps;
215  const Operator O2nsv = O2nsm + O2nss;
216  map<int,Operator> OM;
217  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O2nsp});
218  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O2nsm});
219  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O2nsv});
220  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O2qq});
221  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O2qg});
222  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O2gq});
223  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O2gg});
224  OpMapNNLO.insert({nf, OM});
225  }
226 
227  // ===============================================================
228  // NNNLO splitting function operators. For now only the
229  // non-singlet splitting functions have been computed to leading
230  // colour even though the subleading colour part is estimated
231  // through an approximate parameterisation.
232  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNNNLO;
233  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
234  {
235  const Operator O3nsp{g, P3nsp{nf}, IntEps};
236  const Operator O3nsm{g, P3nsm{nf}, IntEps};
237  const Operator O3nss{g, P3nss{nf}, IntEps};
238  const Operator O3nsv = O3nsm + O3nss;
239  map<int,Operator> OM;
240  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O3nsp});
241  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O3nsm});
242  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O3nsv});
243  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, Zero});
244  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
245  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
246  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Zero});
247  OpMapNNNLO.insert({nf, OM});
248  }
249 
250  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects.
251  map<int,DglapObjects> DglapObj;
252 
253  // Allocate convolution maps for evolution and matching, and set
254  // of operators.
255  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
256  {
257  DglapObjects obj;
258  obj.Threshold = Thresholds[nf-1];
259  if (OpEvol)
260  {
261  const EvolutionOperatorBasisQCD evopb{nf};
262  const MatchingOperatorBasisQCD mtopb{nf};
263  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
264  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
265  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNNLO.at(nf)}});
266  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({3, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNNNLO.at(nf)}});
267  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchLO}});
268  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNLO.at(nf)}});
269  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNNLO.at(nf)}});
270  }
271  else
272  {
273  const EvolutionBasisQCD evb{nf};
274  const MatchingBasisQCD mtb{nf};
275  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
276  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
277  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNNLO.at(nf)}});
278  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({3, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNNNLO.at(nf)}});
279  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchLO}});
280  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNLO.at(nf)}});
281  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNNLO.at(nf)}});
282  }
283  DglapObj.insert({nf,obj});
284  }
285  t.stop();
286 
287  return DglapObj;
288  }
apfel::report
void report(string const &what)
info
Definition: messages.cc:45
apfel::eps12
const double eps12
Definition: constants.h:33

◆ InitializeDglapObjectsQCD() [2/2]

map< int, DglapObjects > apfel::InitializeDglapObjectsQCD ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
bool const &  OpEvol,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Same as above but assuming that Masses = Thresholds.

295  {
296  return InitializeDglapObjectsQCD(g, Thresholds, Thresholds, OpEvol, IntEps);
297  }
apfel::InitializeDglapObjectsQCD
map< int, DglapObjects > InitializeDglapObjectsQCD(Grid const &g, vector< double > const &Thresholds, bool const &OpEvol, double const &IntEps)
Same as above but assuming that Masses = Thresholds.

◆ InitializeDglapObjectsQCDT() [1/2]

map< int, DglapObjects > apfel::InitializeDglapObjectsQCDT ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
bool const &  OpEvol = false,
double const &  IntEps = 1e-5 
)

The InitializeDglapObjectsQCDT, precompute the perturbative coefficients of time-like unpolarised splitting functions and matching conditions and store them in the 'DglapObjects' structure.

Parameters
gthe grid
IntEpsthe integration accuracy
Masses
Thresholds
Returns

Definition at line 300 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

305  {
306  report("Initializing DglapObjects for time-like QCD unpolarised evolution... ");
307  Timer t;
308 
309  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
310  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
311  // vector entries are ordered).
312  int nfi = 0;
313  int nff = Thresholds.size();
314  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
315  if (v <= 0)
316  nfi++;
317 
318  // Compute logs of muth2 / m2 needed for the the matching
319  // conditions.
320  vector<double> LogKth;
321  for (int im = 0; im < (int) Thresholds.size(); im++)
322  if (Thresholds[im] < eps12 || Masses[im] < eps12)
323  LogKth.push_back(0);
324  else
325  LogKth.push_back(2 * log( Thresholds[im] / Masses[im] ));
326 
327  // Allocate needed operators (matching conditions and splitting
328  // functions). By now the code is fast enough to precompute
329  // everything at all available perturbative orders and the current
330  // perturbative order is accounted for only when the actual
331  // splitting functions and matching conditions (lambda) functions
332  // are defined.
333  // ===============================================================
334  // LO Matching conditions.
335  map<int,Operator> MatchLO;
336  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
337  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
338  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Id});
339  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Id});
340  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
341  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
342  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, Id});
343  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
344  MatchLO.insert({i, Id});
345  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
346  MatchLO.insert({i, Zero});
347 
348  // ===============================================================
349  // LO splitting function operators.
350  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapLO;
351  const Operator O0ns{g, P0Tns{}, IntEps};
352  const Operator O0qg{g, P0Tqg{}, IntEps};
353  const Operator O0gq{g, P0Tgq{}, IntEps};
354  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
355  {
356  const Operator O0gg{g, P0Tgg{nf}, IntEps};
357  const Operator O0qgnf = nf * O0qg;
358  map<int,Operator> OM;
359  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O0ns});
360  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O0ns});
361  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O0ns});
362  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O0ns});
363  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O0qgnf});
364  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O0gq});
365  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O0gg});
366  OpMapLO.insert({nf, OM});
367  }
368 
369  // ===============================================================
370  // NLO Matching conditions.
371  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchNLO;
372  const Operator AS1Hg0 {g, ATS1Hg_0{}, IntEps};
373  const Operator AS1HgL {g, ATS1Hg_L{}, IntEps};
374  const Operator AS1ggHL{g, ATS1ggH_L{}, IntEps};
375  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
376  {
377  const Operator AS1Hg = AS1Hg0 + LogKth[nf] * AS1HgL;
378  const Operator AS1ggH = LogKth[nf] * AS1ggHL;
379  const Operator AS1Tg = - nf * AS1Hg;
380  map<int,Operator> OM;
381  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Zero});
382  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Zero});
383  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, AS1Hg});
384  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
385  OM.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, AS1ggH});
386  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
387  OM.insert({i, Zero});
388  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
389  if (i > MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
390  OM.insert({i, AS1Hg});
391  else if (i == MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G + nf - 1)
392  OM.insert({i, AS1Tg});
393  else
394  OM.insert({i, Zero});
395  MatchNLO.insert({nf, OM});
396  }
397 
398  // ===============================================================
399  // NLO splitting function operators.
400  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNLO;
401  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
402  {
403  const Operator O1nsp{g, P1Tnsp{nf}, IntEps};
404  const Operator O1nsm{g, P1Tnsm{nf}, IntEps};
405  const Operator O1ps {g, P1Tps{nf}, IntEps};
406  const Operator O1qg {g, P1Tqg{nf}, IntEps};
407  const Operator O1gq {g, P1Tgq{nf}, IntEps};
408  const Operator O1gg {g, P1Tgg{nf}, IntEps};
409  const Operator O1qq = O1nsp + O1ps;
410  map<int,Operator> OM;
411  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1nsp});
412  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1nsm});
413  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1nsm});
414  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1qq});
415  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O1qg});
416  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O1gq});
417  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O1gg});
418  OpMapNLO.insert({nf, OM});
419  }
420 
421  // ===============================================================
422  // NNLO Matching conditions. Set to zero for now because they are
423  // not know yet.
424  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchNNLO;
425  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
426  {
427  map<int,Operator> OM;
428  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PNS; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
429  OM.insert({i, Zero});
430  MatchNNLO.insert({nf, OM});
431  }
432 
433  // ===============================================================
434  // NNLO splitting function operators.
435  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNNLO;
436  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
437  {
438  const Operator O2nsp{g, P2Tnsp{nf}, IntEps};
439  const Operator O2nsm{g, P2Tnsm{nf}, IntEps};
440  const Operator O2nss{g, P2Tnss{nf}, IntEps};
441  const Operator O2ps {g, P2Tps{nf}, IntEps};
442  const Operator O2qg {g, P2Tqg{nf}, IntEps};
443  const Operator O2gq {g, P2Tgq{nf}, IntEps};
444  const Operator O2gg {g, P2Tgg{nf}, IntEps};
445  const Operator O2qq = O2nsp + O2ps;
446  const Operator O2nsv = O2nsm + O2nss;
447  map<int,Operator> OM;
448  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O2nsp});
449  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O2nsm});
450  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O2nsv});
451  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O2qq});
452  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O2qg});
453  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O2gq});
454  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O2gg});
455  OpMapNNLO.insert({nf, OM});
456  }
457 
458  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects.
459  map<int,DglapObjects> DglapObj;
460 
461  // Allocate convolution maps for evolution and matching, and set
462  // of operators.
463  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
464  {
465  DglapObjects obj;
466  obj.Threshold = Thresholds[nf-1];
467  if (OpEvol)
468  {
469  const EvolutionOperatorBasisQCD evopb{nf};
470  const MatchingOperatorBasisQCD mtopb{nf};
471  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
472  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
473  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNNLO.at(nf)}});
474  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchLO}});
475  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNLO.at(nf)}});
476  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNNLO.at(nf)}});
477  }
478  else
479  {
480  const EvolutionBasisQCD evb{nf};
481  const MatchingBasisQCD mtb{nf};
482  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
483  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
484  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNNLO.at(nf)}});
485  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchLO}});
486  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNLO.at(nf)}});
487  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({2, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNNLO.at(nf)}});
488  }
489  DglapObj.insert({nf,obj});
490  }
491  t.stop();
492 
493  return DglapObj;
494  }
apfel::report
void report(string const &what)
info

apfel::eps12
const double eps12
Definition: constants.h:33

◆ InitializeDglapObjectsQCDtrans() [1/2]

map< int, DglapObjects > apfel::InitializeDglapObjectsQCDtrans ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
bool const &  OpEvol = false,
double const &  IntEps = 1e-5 
)

The InitializeDglapObjectsQCDTrans, precompute the perturbative coefficients of space-like transversely polarised splitting functions and matching conditions and store them in the 'DglapObjects' structure.

Parameters
gthe grid
IntEpsthe integration accuracy
Masses
Thresholds
Returns

Definition at line 506 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

511  {
512  report("Initializing DglapObjects for space-like QCD transversely polarised evolution... ");
513  Timer t;
514 
515  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
516  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
517  // vector entries are ordered).
518  int nfi = 0;
519  int nff = Thresholds.size();
520  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
521  if (v <= 0)
522  nfi++;
523 
524  // Compute logs of muth2 / m2 needed for the the matching
525  // conditions (not possible for transversities yet).
526  vector<double> LogKth;
527  for (int im = 0; im < (int) Thresholds.size(); im++)
528  if (Thresholds[im] < eps12 || Masses[im] < eps12)
529  LogKth.push_back(0);
530  else
531  LogKth.push_back(2 * log( Thresholds[im] / Masses[im] ));
532 
533  // Allocate needed operators (matching conditions and splitting
534  // functions). By now the code is fast enough to precompute
535  // everything at all available perturbative orders and the current
536  // perturbative order is accounted for only when the actual
537  // splitting functions and matching conditions (lambda) functions
538  // are defined.
539  // ===============================================================
540  // LO Matching conditions.
541  map<int,Operator> MatchLO;
542  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
543  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
544  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Id});
545  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Id});
546  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
547  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
548  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, Id});
549  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
550  MatchLO.insert({i, Id});
551  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
552  MatchLO.insert({i, Zero});
553 
554  // ===============================================================
555  // LO splitting function operators.
556  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapLO;
557  const Operator O0ns{g, P0transns{}, IntEps};
558  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
559  {
560  map<int,Operator> OM;
561  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O0ns});
562  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O0ns});
563  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O0ns});
564  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O0ns});
565  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
566  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
567  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Zero});
568  OpMapLO.insert({nf, OM});
569  }
570 
571  // ===============================================================
572  // NLO Matching conditions (Null).
573  map<int,Operator> MatchNLO;
574  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PNS; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
575  MatchNLO.insert({i, Zero});
576 
577  // ===============================================================
578  // NLO splitting function operators.
579  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNLO;
580  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
581  {
582  const Operator O1nsp{g, P1transnsp{nf}, IntEps};
583  const Operator O1nsm{g, P1transnsm{nf}, IntEps};
584  map<int,Operator> OM;
585  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1nsp});
586  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1nsm});
587  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1nsm});
588  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1nsp});
589  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
590  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
591  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Zero});
592  OpMapNLO.insert({nf, OM});
593  }
594 
595  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects.
596  map<int,DglapObjects> DglapObj;
597 
598  // Allocate convolution maps for evolution and matching, and set
599  // of operators.
600  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
601  {
602  DglapObjects obj;
603  obj.Threshold = Thresholds[nf-1];
604  if (OpEvol)
605  {
606  const EvolutionOperatorBasisQCD evopb{nf};
607  const MatchingOperatorBasisQCD mtopb{nf};
608  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
609  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
610  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchLO}});
611  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNLO}});
612  }
613  else
614  {
615  const EvolutionBasisQCD evb{nf};
616  const MatchingBasisQCD mtb{nf};
617  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
618  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
619  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchLO}});
620  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNLO}});
621  }
622  DglapObj.insert({nf,obj});
623  }
624  t.stop();
625 
626  return DglapObj;
627  }

)

The InitializeDglapObjectsQCDTrans, precompute the perturbative coefficients of time-like transversely polarised splitting functions and matching conditions and store them in the 'DglapObjects' structure.

Parameters
gthe grid
IntEpsthe integration accuracy
Masses
Thresholds
Returns

Definition at line 639 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

644  {
645  report("Initializing DglapObjects for time-like QCD transversely polarised evolution... ");
646  Timer t;
647 
648  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
649  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
650  // vector entries are ordered).
651  int nfi = 0;
652  int nff = Thresholds.size();
653  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
654  if (v <= 0)
655  nfi++;
656 
657  // Compute logs of muth2 / m2 needed for the the matching
658  // conditions (not possible for transversities yet).
659  vector<double> LogKth;
660  for (int im = 0; im < (int) Thresholds.size(); im++)
661  if (Thresholds[im] < eps12 || Masses[im] < eps12)
662  LogKth.push_back(0);
663  else
664  LogKth.push_back(2 * log( Thresholds[im] / Masses[im] ));
665 
666  // Allocate needed operators (matching conditions and splitting
667  // functions). By now the code is fast enough to precompute
668  // everything at all available perturbative orders and the current
669  // perturbative order is accounted for only when the actual
670  // splitting functions and matching conditions (lambda) functions
671  // are defined.
672  // ===============================================================
673  // LO Matching conditions.
674  map<int,Operator> MatchLO;
675  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
676  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
677  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PNS, Id});
678  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQQ, Id});
679  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
680  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
681  MatchLO.insert({MatchingBasisQCD::PGG, Id});
682  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3Q; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35Q; i++)
683  MatchLO.insert({i, Id});
684  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PT3G; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
685  MatchLO.insert({i, Zero});
686 
687  // ===============================================================
688  // LO splitting function operators.
689  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapLO;
690  const Operator O0ns{g, P0Ttransns{}, IntEps};
691  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
692  {
693  map<int,Operator> OM;
694  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O0ns});
695  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O0ns});
696  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O0ns});
697  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O0ns});
698  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
699  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
700  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Zero});
701  OpMapLO.insert({nf, OM});
702  }
703 
704  // ===============================================================
705  // NLO Matching conditions (Null).
706  map<int,Operator> MatchNLO;
707  for (int i = MatchingBasisQCD::PNS; i <= MatchingBasisQCD::PT35G; i++)
708  MatchNLO.insert({i, Zero});
709 
710  // ===============================================================
711  // NLO splitting function operators.
712  map<int,map<int,Operator>> OpMapNLO;
713  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
714  {
715  const Operator O1nsp{g, P1Ttransnsp{nf}, IntEps};
716  const Operator O1nsm{g, P1Ttransnsm{nf}, IntEps};
717  map<int,Operator> OM;
718  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1nsp});
719  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1nsm});
720  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1nsm});
721  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1nsp});
722  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
723  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
724  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Zero});
725  OpMapNLO.insert({nf, OM});
726  }
727 
728  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects.
729  map<int,DglapObjects> DglapObj;
730 
731  // Allocate convolution maps for evolution and matching, and set
732  // of operators.
733  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
734  {
735  DglapObjects obj;
736  obj.Threshold = Thresholds[nf-1];
737  if (OpEvol)
738  {
739  const EvolutionOperatorBasisQCD evopb{nf};
740  const MatchingOperatorBasisQCD mtopb{nf};
741  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
742  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evopb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
743  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchLO}});
744  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtopb, MatchNLO}});
745  }
746  else
747  {
748  const EvolutionBasisQCD evb{nf};
749  const MatchingBasisQCD mtb{nf};
750  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapLO.at(nf)}});
751  obj.SplittingFunctions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, OpMapNLO.at(nf)}});
752  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({0, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchLO}});
753  obj.MatchingConditions.insert({1, Set<Operator>{mtb, MatchNLO}});
754  }
755  DglapObj.insert({nf,obj});
756  }
757  t.stop();
758 
759  return DglapObj;
760  }

◆ InitializeF2CCMinusObjectsZM()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeF2CCMinusObjectsZM ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Definition at line 321 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

324  {
325  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for ( F2(nu) - F2(nubar) ) / 2 Zero Mass... ");
326  Timer t;
327 
328  // ===============================================================
329  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
330  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
331 
332  // LO
333  map<int,Operator> C2LO;
334  C2LO.insert({CNS, Id});
335  C2LO.insert({CS, Zero});
336  C2LO.insert({CG, Zero});
337 
338  // NLO
339  map<int,Operator> C2NLO;
340  const Operator O21ns{g, C21ns{}, IntEps};
341  C2NLO.insert({CNS, O21ns});
342  C2NLO.insert({CS, Zero});
343  C2NLO.insert({CG, Zero});
344 
345  // NNLO
346  map<int,map<int,Operator>> C2NNLO;
347  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
348  {
349  const Operator O22nsm{g, C22nsm{nf}, IntEps};
350  map<int,Operator> C2NNLOnf;
351  C2NNLOnf.insert({CNS, O22nsm});
352  C2NNLOnf.insert({CS, Zero});
353  C2NNLOnf.insert({CG, Zero});
354  C2NNLO.insert({nf,C2NNLOnf});
355  }
356 
357  // Vector of distributions to skip
358  const vector<int> skip = {0,1,2,3,5,7,9,11};
359 
360  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
361  const auto F2Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
362  {
363  // Determine number of active flavours.
364  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
365 
366  // Effective charges.
367  vector<double> EffCh;
368  if (nf <= 3)
369  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
370  else if (nf == 4)
371  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, Ch[3], Ch[4], 0, 0, 0, 0};
372  else if (nf == 5)
373  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], Ch[2], Ch[3], Ch[4], Ch[5], 0, 0, 0};
374  else
375  EffCh = Ch;
376 
377  // Fill in structure function object
378  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
379  FObj.skip = skip;
380  // Single structure function components.
381  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
382  {
383  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISCCBasis{EffCh, false} : DISCCBasis{k, false, EffCh[k-1]})});
384  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2LO}});
385  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NLO}});
386  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NNLO.at(nf)}});
387  }
388  return FObj;
389  };
390  t.stop();
391 
392  return F2Obj;
393  }
apfel::CG
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::report
void report(string const &what)
info
Definition: messages.cc:45
apfel::CNS
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::CS
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::NF
int NF(double const &Q, vector< double > const &Thresholds)
Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds...
Definition: tools.cc:13

◆ InitializeF2CCPlusObjectsZM()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeF2CCPlusObjectsZM ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Definition at line 242 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

245  {
246  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for ( F2(nu) + F2(nubar) ) / 2 Zero Mass... ");
247  Timer t;
248 
249  // ===============================================================
250  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
251  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
252 
253  // LO
254  map<int,Operator> C2LO;
255  C2LO.insert({CNS, Id});
256  C2LO.insert({CS, Id});
257  C2LO.insert({CG, Zero});
258 
259  // NLO
260  map<int,Operator> C2NLO;
261  const Operator O21ns{g, C21ns{}, IntEps};
262  const Operator O21g {g, C21g{}, IntEps};
263  C2NLO.insert({CNS, O21ns});
264  C2NLO.insert({CS, O21ns});
265  C2NLO.insert({CG, O21g});
266 
267  // NNLO
268  map<int,map<int,Operator>> C2NNLO;
269  const Operator O22ps{g, C22ps{}, IntEps};
270  const Operator O22g {g, C22g{}, IntEps};
271  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
272  {
273  const Operator O22nsp{g, C22nsp{nf}, IntEps};
274  const Operator O22t = O22nsp + 6 * O22ps;
275  map<int,Operator> C2NNLOnf;
276  C2NNLOnf.insert({CNS, O22nsp});
277  C2NNLOnf.insert({CS, O22t});
278  C2NNLOnf.insert({CG, O22g});
279  C2NNLO.insert({nf,C2NNLOnf});
280  }
281 
282  // Vector of distributions to skip
283  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
284 
285  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
286  const auto F2Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
287  {
288  // Determine number of active flavours.
289  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
290 
291  // Effective charges.
292  vector<double> EffCh;
293  if (nf <= 3)
294  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
295  else if (nf == 4)
296  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, Ch[3], Ch[4], 0, 0, 0, 0};
297  else if (nf == 5)
298  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], Ch[2], Ch[3], Ch[4], Ch[5], 0, 0, 0};
299  else
300  EffCh = Ch;
301 
302  // Fill in structure function object
303  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
304  FObj.skip = skip;
305  // Single structure function components.
306  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
307  {
308  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISCCBasis{EffCh, false} : DISCCBasis{k, false, EffCh[k-1]})});
309  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2LO}});
310  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NLO}});
311  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NNLO.at(nf)}});
312  }
313  return FObj;
314  };
315  t.stop();
316 
317  return F2Obj;
318  }
apfel::CG
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::report
void report(string const &what)
info

apfel::CS

apfel::NF
int NF(double const &Q, vector< double > const &Thresholds)
Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds...

◆ InitializeF2NCObjectsMassive()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeF2NCObjectsMassive ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
double const &  IntEps,
int const &  nxi,
double const &  ximin,
double const &  ximax,
int const &  intdeg,
double const &  lambda 
)

Definition at line 699 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

707  {
708  Timer t;
709 
710  // Determine number of active flavours
711  int actnf = 0;
712  for (auto const& m : Masses)
713  if (m < eps8)
714  actnf++;
715 
716  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for F2 NC Massive with " + to_string(actnf) + " active flavours... \n");
717 
718  // ===============================================================
719  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
720  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
721 
722  // Zero Mass coefficient functions
723  // LO
724  map<int,Operator> C2LO;
725  C2LO.insert({CNS, Id});
726  C2LO.insert({CS, Id});
727  C2LO.insert({CG, Zero});
728 
729  // NLO
730  map<int,Operator> C2NLO;
731  const Operator O21ns{g, C21ns{}, IntEps};
732  const Operator O21g {g, C21g{}, IntEps};
733  C2NLO.insert({CNS, O21ns});
734  C2NLO.insert({CS, O21ns});
735  C2NLO.insert({CG, O21g});
736 
737  // NNLO
738  const Operator O22ps {g, C22ps{}, IntEps};
739  const Operator O22g {g, C22g{}, IntEps};
740  const Operator O22nsp{g, C22nsp{actnf}, IntEps};
741  const Operator O22t = O22nsp + 6 * O22ps;
742 
743  // Massive coefficient functions
744  // Null set of operator needed for the LO coefficient functions.
745  map<int,Operator> Not;
746  Not.insert({CNS, Zero});
747  Not.insert({CS, Zero});
748  Not.insert({CG, Zero});
749 
750  // NLO
751  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO21g{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
752  {
753  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
754  return Operator{g, Cm21gNC{teta}, IntEps};
755  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
756 
757  // NNLO
758  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22ns{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
759  {
760  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
761  return Operator{g, Cm22nsNC{teta}, IntEps};
762  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
763  const auto fO22s = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
764  {
765  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
766  const Operator O22psc{g, Cm22psNC{teta}, IntEps};
767  const Operator O22psl{g, Cm22barpsNC{teta}, IntEps};
768  return 6 * ( O22psc + log(xi) * O22psl );
769  };
770  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22s{fO22s, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
771  const auto fO22g = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
772  {
773  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
774  const Operator O22gc{g, Cm22gNC{teta}, IntEps};
775  const Operator O22gl{g, Cm22bargNC{teta}, IntEps};
776  return O22gc + log(xi) * O22gl;
777  };
778  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22g{fO22g, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
779 
780  // Vector of distributions to skip
781  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
782 
783  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
784  const auto F2Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
785  {
786  // Fill in structure function object
787  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
788  FObj.skip = skip;
789 
790  // Start with the heavy quark structure function components.
791  const double Q2 = Q * Q;
792  Operator lNNLOns = O22nsp;
793  for (int k = actnf + 1; k <= 6; k++)
794  {
795  // Compute value of xi.
796  const double M2 = Masses[k-1] * Masses[k-1];
797  const double xi = Q2 / M2;
798 
799  // Convolution Basis
800  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
801 
802  // Set LO non-singlet and singlet coefficient
803  // functions to zero (gluon is already zero).
804  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),Not}});
805 
806  // Now insert NLO
807  map<int,Operator> NLO;
808  NLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
809  NLO.insert({CS, Zero});
810  NLO.insert({CG, TabO21g.Evaluate(xi)});
811  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NLO}});
812 
813  // Now insert NNLO
814  map<int,Operator> NNLO;
815  NNLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
816  NNLO.insert({CS, TabO22s.Evaluate(xi)});
817  NNLO.insert({CG, TabO22g.Evaluate(xi)});
818  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NNLO}});
819 
820  // Include the massive bit to the non-singlet coefficient
821  // function needed for the light structure functions.
822  for (int i = 0; i <= actnf; i++)
823  lNNLOns += TabO22ns.Evaluate(xi);
824  }
825 
826  // Now fill in the light components. To be updated in the
827  // loop over the heavy component.
828  map<int,Operator> C2NNLO;
829  C2NNLO.insert({CNS, lNNLOns});
830  C2NNLO.insert({CS, O22t});
831  C2NNLO.insert({CG, O22g});
832  for (int k = 1; k <= actnf; k++)
833  {
834  // Convolution Basis
835  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
836  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2LO}});
837  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NLO}});
838  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NNLO}});
839  }
840 
841  // Total structure function set to zero for now. Need to
842  // construct it a posteriori as a sum of light and heavy
843  // components.
844  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({0, DISNCBasis{Ch}});
845  FObj.C0.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
846  FObj.C1.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
847  FObj.C2.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
848  return FObj;
849  };
850  t.stop();
851 
852  return F2Obj;
853  }

Definition: disbasis.h:23

void report(string const &what)

1021  Timer t;

1023  // Determine number of active flavours
1024  int actnf = 0;
1025  for (auto const& m : Masses)
1026  if (m < eps8)
1027  actnf++;
1028 
1029  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for F2 NC Massive Zero with " + to_string(actnf) + " active flavours... \n");
1030 
1031  // ===============================================================
1032  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
1033  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
1034 
1035  // Zero Mass coefficient functions
1036  // LO
1037  map<int,Operator> C2LO;
1038  C2LO.insert({CNS, Id});
1039  C2LO.insert({CS, Id});
1040  C2LO.insert({CG, Zero});
1041

1044  const Operator O21ns{g, C21ns{}, IntEps};

1047  C2NLO.insert({CS, O21ns});
1048  C2NLO.insert({CG, O21g});
1049 
1050  // NNLO
1051  const Operator O22ps {g, C22ps{}, IntEps};
1052  const Operator O22g {g, C22g{}, IntEps};
1053  const Operator O22nsp{g, C22nsp{actnf}, IntEps};
1054  const Operator O22t = O22nsp + 6 * O22ps;
1055 
1056  // Massive zero coefficient functions
1057  // Null set of operator needed for the LO coefficient functions.
1058  map<int,Operator> Not;
1059  Not.insert({CNS, Zero});
1060  Not.insert({CS, Zero});
1061  Not.insert({CG, Zero});
1062 
1063  // Initialize massive zero coefficient functions
1064  const Operator Om021gc {g, Cm021gNC_c{}, IntEps};
1065  const Operator Om021gl {g, Cm021gNC_l{}, IntEps};
1066  const Operator Om022nsc {g, Cm022nsNC_c{}, IntEps};
1067  const Operator Om022nsl {g, Cm022nsNC_l{}, IntEps};
1068  const Operator Om022nsl2{g, Cm022nsNC_l2{}, IntEps};
1069  const Operator Om022psc {g, Cm022psNC_c{}, IntEps};
1070  const Operator Om022psl {g, Cm022psNC_l{}, IntEps};
1071  const Operator Om022psl2{g, Cm022psNC_l2{}, IntEps};
1072  const Operator Om022psf {g, Cm022psNC_f{}, IntEps};
1073  const Operator Om022pslf{g, Cm022psNC_lf{}, IntEps};
1074  const Operator Om022gc {g, Cm022gNC_c{}, IntEps};
1075  const Operator Om022gl {g, Cm022gNC_l{}, IntEps};
1076  const Operator Om022gl2 {g, Cm022gNC_l2{}, IntEps};
1077  const Operator Om022gf {g, Cm022gNC_f{}, IntEps};
1078  const Operator Om022glf {g, Cm022gNC_lf{}, IntEps};
1079 
1080  // NLO
1081  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO21g{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1082  {
1083  const double lxi = log(xi);
1084  return Om021gc + lxi * Om021gl;
1085  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1086 
1087  // NNLO
1088  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22ns{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1089  {
1090  const double lxi = log(xi);
1091  const double lxi2 = lxi * lxi;
1092  return Om022nsc + lxi * Om022nsl + lxi2 * Om022nsl2;
1093  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1094  const auto fO22s = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1095  {
1096  const double lxi = log(xi);
1097  const double lxi2 = lxi * lxi;
1098  const double lxiF = - lxi;
1099  return 6 * ( Om022psc + lxi * Om022psl + lxi2 * Om022psl2 + lxiF * Om022psf + lxi * lxiF * Om022pslf );
1100  };
1101  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22s{fO22s, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1102  const auto fO22g = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1103  {
1104  const double lxi = log(xi);
1105  const double lxi2 = lxi * lxi;
1106  const double lxiF = - lxi;
1107  return Om022gc + lxi * Om022gl + lxi2 * Om022gl2 + lxiF * Om022gf + lxi * lxiF * Om022glf;
1108  };
1109  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabO22g{fO22g, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1110 
1111  // Vector of distributions to skip
1112  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
1113 
1114  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
1115  const auto F2Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
1116  {
1117  // Fill in structure function object
1118  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
1119  FObj.skip = skip;
1120 
1121  // Start with the heavy quark structure function components.
1122  const double Q2 = Q * Q;
1123  Operator lNNLOns = O22nsp;
1124  for (int k = actnf + 1; k <= 6; k++)
1125  {
1126  // Compute value of xi.
1127  const double M2 = Masses[k-1] * Masses[k-1];
1128  const double xi = Q2 / M2;
1129 
1130  // Convolution Basis
1131  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
1132 
1133  // Set LO non-singlet and singlet coefficient
1134  // functions to zero (gluon is already zero).
1135  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),Not}});
1136 
1137  // Now insert NLO
1138  map<int,Operator> NLO;
1139  NLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
1140  NLO.insert({CS, Zero});
1141  NLO.insert({CG, TabO21g.Evaluate(xi)});
1142  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NLO}});
1143 
1144  // Now insert NNLO
1145  map<int,Operator> NNLO;
1146  NNLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
1147  NNLO.insert({CS, TabO22s.Evaluate(xi)});
1148  NNLO.insert({CG, TabO22g.Evaluate(xi)});
1149  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NNLO}});
1150 
1151  // Include the massive bit to the non-singlet coefficient
1152  // function needed for the light structure functions.
1153  for (int i = 0; i <= actnf; i++)
1154  lNNLOns += TabO22ns.Evaluate(xi);
1155  }
1156 
1157  // Now fill in the light components. To be updated in the
1158  // loop over the heavy component.
1159  map<int,Operator> C2NNLO;
1160  C2NNLO.insert({CNS, lNNLOns});
1161  C2NNLO.insert({CS, O22t});
1162  C2NNLO.insert({CG, O22g});
1163  for (int k = 1; k <= actnf; k++)
1164  {
1165  // Convolution Basis
1166  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k, DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
1167  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2LO}});
1168  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NLO}});
1169  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NNLO}});
1170  }
1171 
1172  // Total structure function set to zero for now. Need to
1173  // construct it a posteriori as a sum of light and heavy
1174  // components.
1175  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({0, DISNCBasis{Ch}});
1176  FObj.C0.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1177  FObj.C1.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1178  FObj.C2.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1179  return FObj;
1180  };
1181  t.stop();
1182 
1183  return F2Obj;
1184  }

27  {
28  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for F2 NC Zero Mass... ");
29  Timer t;
30 
31  // ===============================================================
32  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
33  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
34 
35  // LO
36  map<int,Operator> C2LO;
37  C2LO.insert({CNS, Id});
38  C2LO.insert({CS, Id});
39  C2LO.insert({CG, Zero});
40 
41  // NLO
42  map<int,Operator> C2NLO;
43  const Operator O21ns{g, C21ns{}, IntEps};
44  const Operator O21g {g, C21g{}, IntEps};
45  C2NLO.insert({CNS, O21ns});
46  C2NLO.insert({CS, O21ns});
47  C2NLO.insert({CG, O21g});
48 
49  // NNLO
50  map<int,map<int,Operator>> C2NNLO;
51  const Operator O22ps{g, C22ps{}, IntEps};
52  const Operator O22g {g, C22g{}, IntEps};
53  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
54  {
55  const Operator O22nsp{g, C22nsp{nf}, IntEps};
56  const Operator O22t = O22nsp + 6 * O22ps;
57  map<int,Operator> C2NNLOnf;
58  C2NNLOnf.insert({CNS, O22nsp});
59  C2NNLOnf.insert({CS, O22t});
60  C2NNLOnf.insert({CG, O22g});
61  C2NNLO.insert({nf,C2NNLOnf});
62  }
63 
64  // Vector of distributions to skip
65  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
66 
67  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
68  const auto F2Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
69  {
70  // Determine number of active flavours.
71  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
72 
73  // Effective charges. The charges of the components with mh >
74  // Q are set to zero.
75  vector<double> EffCh;
76  for (int k = 1; k <= 6; k++)
77  EffCh.push_back(( k > nf ? 0 : Ch[k-1]));
78 
79  // Fill in structure function object
80  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
81  FObj.skip = skip;
82  // Single structure function components.
83  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
84  {
85  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISNCBasis{EffCh} : DISNCBasis{k, EffCh[k-1]})});
86  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2LO}});
87  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NLO}});
88  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C2NNLO.at(nf)}});
89  }
90  return FObj;
91  };
92  t.stop();
93 
94  return F2Obj;
95  }

int NF(double const &Q, vector< double > const &Thresholds)
Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds...
