◆ InitializeF3CCMinusObjectsZM()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeF3CCMinusObjectsZM ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Definition at line 624 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

627  {
628  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for ( F3(nu) - F3(nubar) ) / 2 Zero Mass... ");
629  Timer t;
630 
631  // ===============================================================
632  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
633  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
634 
635  // LO
636  map<int,Operator> C3LO;
637  C3LO.insert({CNS, Id});
638  C3LO.insert({CS, Id});
639  C3LO.insert({CG, Zero});
640 
641  // NLO
642  map<int,Operator> C3NLO;
643  const Operator O31ns{g, C31ns{}, IntEps};
644  C3NLO.insert({CNS, O31ns});
645  C3NLO.insert({CS, O31ns});
646  C3NLO.insert({CG, Zero});
647 
648  // NNLO
649  map<int,map<int,Operator>> C3NNLO;
650  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
651  {
652  const Operator O32nsm{g, C32nsm{nf}, IntEps};
653  map<int,Operator> C3NNLOnf;
654  C3NNLOnf.insert({CNS, O32nsm});
655  C3NNLOnf.insert({CS, O32nsm});
656  C3NNLOnf.insert({CG, Zero});
657  C3NNLO.insert({nf,C3NNLOnf});
658  }
659 
660  // Vector of distributions to skip
661  const vector<int> skip = {0,1,3,5,7,9,11};
662 
663  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
664  const auto F3Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
665  {
666  // Determine number of active flavours.
667  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
668 
669  // Effective charges.
670  vector<double> EffCh;
671  if (nf <= 3)
672  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
673  else if (nf == 4)
674  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, Ch[3], Ch[4], 0, 0, 0, 0};
675  else if (nf == 5)
676  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], Ch[2], Ch[3], Ch[4], Ch[5], 0, 0, 0};
677  else
678  EffCh = Ch;
679 
680  // Fill in structure function object
681  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
682  FObj.skip = skip;
683  // Single structure function components.
684  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
685  {
686  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISCCBasis{EffCh, true} : DISCCBasis{k, true, EffCh[k-1]})});
687  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3LO}});
688  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NLO}});
689  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NNLO.at(nf)}});
690  }
691  return FObj;
692  };
693  t.stop();
694 
695  return F3Obj;
696  }
apfel::CG
Definition: disbasis.h:23

apfel::CS

558

560  map<int,Operator> C3LO;
561  C3LO.insert({CNS, Id});
562  C3LO.insert({CS, Id});
563  C3LO.insert({CG, Zero});
564 
565  // NLO
566  map<int,Operator> C3NLO;
567  const Operator O31ns{g, C31ns{}, IntEps};
568  C3NLO.insert({CNS, O31ns});
569  C3NLO.insert({CS, O31ns});
570  C3NLO.insert({CG, Zero});

577  const Operator O32t = O32nsp;

580  C3NNLOnf.insert({CS, O32t});
581  C3NNLOnf.insert({CG, Zero});
582  C3NNLO.insert({nf,C3NNLOnf});
583  }

586  const vector<int> skip = {0,1,2,4,6,8,10,12};

589  const auto F3Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
590  {
591  // Determine number of active flavours.
592  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
593 
594  // Effective charges.
595  vector<double> EffCh;
596  if (nf <= 3)
597  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
598  else if (nf == 4)
599  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, Ch[3], Ch[4], 0, 0, 0, 0};
600  else if (nf == 5)
601  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], Ch[2], Ch[3], Ch[4], Ch[5], 0, 0, 0};
602  else
603  EffCh = Ch;

606  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
607  FObj.skip = skip;
608  // Single structure function components.
609  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
610  {
611  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISCCBasis{EffCh, true} : DISCCBasis{k, true, EffCh[k-1]})});
612  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3LO}});
613  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NLO}});
614  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NNLO.at(nf)}});
615  }
616  return FObj;
617  };
618  t.stop();
619 
620  return F3Obj;
621  }

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeF3NCObjectsZM ( Grid const &  g,

Definition at line 171 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

174  {
175  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for F3 NC Zero Mass... ");
176  Timer t;
177 
178  // ===============================================================
179  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
180  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
181 
182  // LO
183  map<int,Operator> C3LO;
184  C3LO.insert({CNS, Id});
185  C3LO.insert({CS, Id});
186  C3LO.insert({CG, Zero});
187 
188  // NLO
189  map<int,Operator> C3NLO;
190  const Operator O31ns{g, C31ns{}, IntEps};
191  C3NLO.insert({CNS, O31ns});
192  C3NLO.insert({CS, O31ns});
193  C3NLO.insert({CG, Zero});
194 
195  // NNLO
196  map<int,map<int,Operator>> C3NNLO;
197  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
198  {
199  const Operator O32nsm{g, C32nsm{nf}, IntEps};
200  const Operator O32t = O32nsm;
201  map<int,Operator> C3NNLOnf;
202  C3NNLOnf.insert({CNS, O32nsm});
203  C3NNLOnf.insert({CS, O32t});
204  C3NNLOnf.insert({CG, Zero});
205  C3NNLO.insert({nf,C3NNLOnf});
206  }
207 
208  // Vector of distributions to skip
209  const vector<int> skip = {1,3,5,7,9,11};
210 
211  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
212  const auto F3Obj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
213  {
214  // Determine number of active flavours.
215  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
216 
217  // Effective charges. The charges of the components with mh >
218  // Q are set to zero.
219  vector<double> EffCh;
220  for (int k = 1; k <= 6; k++)
221  EffCh.push_back(( k > nf ? 0 : Ch[k-1]));
222 
223  // Fill in structure function object
224  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
225  FObj.skip = skip;
226  // Single structure function components.
227  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
228  {
229  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISNCBasis{EffCh} : DISNCBasis{k, EffCh[k-1]})});
230  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3LO}});
231  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NLO}});
232  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), C3NNLO.at(nf)}});
233  }
234  return FObj;
235  };
236  t.stop();
237 
238  return F3Obj;
239  }

477  {
478  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for ( FL(nu) - FL(nubar) ) / 2 Zero Mass... ");
479  Timer t;
480 
481  // ===============================================================

483

485  map<int,Operator> CLLO;
486  CLLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
487  CLLO.insert({CS, Zero});
488  CLLO.insert({CG, Zero});
489 
490  // NLO
491  map<int,Operator> CLNLO;
492  const Operator OL1ns{g, CL1ns{}, IntEps};
493  CLNLO.insert({CNS, OL1ns});
494  CLNLO.insert({CS, Zero});
495  CLNLO.insert({CG, Zero});
496

498  map<int,map<int,Operator>> CLNNLO;

514  {

522  else if (nf == 4)

533  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)

536  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLLO}});
537  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNLO}});

539  }
540  return FObj;
541  };
542  t.stop();

544  return FLObj;
545  }

)

Definition at line 396 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

399  {
400  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for ( FL(nu) + FL(nubar) ) / 2 Zero Mass... ");
401  Timer t;
402 
403  // ===============================================================
404  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
405 
406  // LO
407  map<int,Operator> CLLO;
408  CLLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
409  CLLO.insert({CS, Zero});
410  CLLO.insert({CG, Zero});
411 
412  // NLO
413  map<int,Operator> CLNLO;
414  const Operator OL1ns{g, CL1ns{}, IntEps};
415  const Operator OL1g {g, CL1g{}, IntEps};
416  CLNLO.insert({CNS, OL1ns});
417  CLNLO.insert({CS, OL1ns});
418  CLNLO.insert({CG, OL1g});
419 
420  // NNLO
421  map<int,map<int,Operator>> CLNNLO;
422  const Operator OL2ps{g, CL2ps{}, IntEps};
423  const Operator OL2g {g, CL2g{}, IntEps};
424  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
425  {
426  const Operator OL2nsp{g, CL2nsp{nf}, IntEps};
427  const Operator OL2t = OL2nsp + 6 * OL2ps;
428  map<int,Operator> CLNNLOnf;
429  CLNNLOnf.insert({CNS, OL2nsp});
430  CLNNLOnf.insert({CS, OL2t});
431  CLNNLOnf.insert({CG, OL2g});
432  CLNNLO.insert({nf,CLNNLOnf});
433  }
434 
435  // Vector of distributions to skip
436  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
437 
438  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
439  const auto FLObj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
440  {
441  // Determine number of active flavours.
442  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
443 
444  // Effective charges.
445  vector<double> EffCh;
446  if (nf <= 3)
447  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0};
448  else if (nf == 4)
449  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], 0, Ch[3], Ch[4], 0, 0, 0, 0};
450  else if (nf == 5)
451  EffCh = {Ch[0], Ch[1], Ch[2], Ch[3], Ch[4], Ch[5], 0, 0, 0};
452  else
453  EffCh = Ch;
454 
455  // Fill in structure function object
456  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
457  FObj.skip = skip;
458  // Single structure function components.
459  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
460  {
461  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISCCBasis{EffCh, false} : DISCCBasis{k, false, EffCh[k-1]})});
462  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLLO}});
463  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNLO}});
464  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNNLO.at(nf)}});
465  }
466  return FObj;
467  };
468  t.stop();
469 
470  return FLObj;
471  }

◆ InitializeFLNCObjectsMassive()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeFLNCObjectsMassive ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
double const &  IntEps,
int const &  nxi,
double const &  ximin,
double const &  ximax,
int const &  intdeg,
double const &  lambda 
)

Definition at line 856 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

864  {
865  Timer t;
866 
867  // Determine number of active flavours
868  int actnf = 0;
869  for (auto const& m : Masses)
870  if (m < eps8)
871  actnf++;
872 
873  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for FL NC Massive with " + to_string(actnf) + " active flavours... \n");
874 
875  // ===============================================================
876  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
877 
878  // Zero Mass coefficient functions
879  // LO
880  map<int,Operator> CLLO;
881  CLLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
882  CLLO.insert({CS, Zero});
883  CLLO.insert({CG, Zero});
884 
885  // NLO
886  map<int,Operator> CLNLO;
887  const Operator OL1ns{g, CL1ns{}, IntEps};
888  const Operator OL1g {g, CL1g{}, IntEps};
889  CLNLO.insert({CNS, OL1ns});
890  CLNLO.insert({CS, OL1ns});
891  CLNLO.insert({CG, OL1g});
892 
893  // NNLO
894  const Operator OL2ps {g, CL2ps{}, IntEps};
895  const Operator OL2g {g, CL2g{}, IntEps};
896  const Operator OL2nsp{g, CL2nsp{actnf}, IntEps};
897  const Operator OL2t = OL2nsp + 6 * OL2ps;
898 
899  // Massive coefficient functions
900  // Null set of operator needed for the LO coefficient functions.
901  map<int,Operator> Not;
902  Not.insert({CNS, Zero});
903  Not.insert({CS, Zero});
904  Not.insert({CG, Zero});
905 
906  // NLO
907  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL1g{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
908  {
909  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
910  return Operator{g, CmL1gNC{teta}, IntEps};
911  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
912 
913  // NNLO
914  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2ns{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
915  {
916  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
917  return Operator{g, CmL2nsNC{teta}, IntEps};
918  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
919  const auto fOL2s = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
920  {
921  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
922  const Operator OL2psc{g, CmL2psNC{teta}, IntEps};
923  const Operator OL2psl{g, CmL2barpsNC{teta}, IntEps};
924  return 6 * ( OL2psc + log(xi) * OL2psl );
925  };
926  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2s{fOL2s, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
927  const auto fOL2g = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
928  {
929  const double teta = 1 / ( 1 + 4 / xi );
930  const Operator OL2gc{g, CmL2gNC{teta}, IntEps};
931  const Operator OL2gl{g, CmL2bargNC{teta}, IntEps};
932  return OL2gc + log(xi) * OL2gl;
933  };
934  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2g{fOL2g, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
935 
936  // Vector of distributions to skip
937  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
938 
939  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
940  const auto FLObj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
941  {
942  // Fill in structure function object
943  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
944  FObj.skip = skip;
945 
946  // Start with the heavy quark structure function components.
947  const double Q2 = Q * Q;
948  Operator lNNLOns = OL2nsp;
949  for (int k = actnf + 1; k <= 6; k++)
950  {
951  // Compute value of xi.
952  const double M2 = Masses[k-1] * Masses[k-1];
953  const double xi = Q2 / M2;
954 
955  // Convolution Basis
956  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
957 
958  // Set LO non-singlet and singlet coefficient
959  // functions to zero (gluon is already zero).
960  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),Not}});
961 
962  // Now insert NLO
963  map<int,Operator> NLO;
964  NLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
965  NLO.insert({CS, Zero});
966  NLO.insert({CG, TabOL1g.Evaluate(xi)});
967  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NLO}});
968 
969  // Now insert NNLO
970  map<int,Operator> NNLO;
971  NNLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
972  NNLO.insert({CS, TabOL2s.Evaluate(xi)});
973  NNLO.insert({CG, TabOL2g.Evaluate(xi)});
974  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NNLO}});
975 
976  // Include the massive bit to the non-singlet coefficient
977  // function needed for the light structure functions.
978  for (int i = 0; i <= actnf; i++)
979  lNNLOns += TabOL2ns.Evaluate(xi);
980  }
981 
982  // Now fill in the light components. To be updated in the
983  // loop over the heavy component.
984  map<int,Operator> CLNNLO;
985  CLNNLO.insert({CNS, lNNLOns});
986  CLNNLO.insert({CS, OL2t});
987  CLNNLO.insert({CG, OL2g});
988  for (int k = 1; k <= actnf; k++)
989  {
990  // Convolution Basis
991  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k, DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
992  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLLO}});
993  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNLO}});
994  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNNLO}});
995  }
996 
997  // Total structure function set to zero for now. Need to
998  // construct it a posteriori as a sum of light and heavy
999  // components.
1000  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({0, DISNCBasis{Ch}});
1001  FObj.C0.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1002  FObj.C1.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1003  FObj.C2.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1004  return FObj;
1005  };
1006  t.stop();
1007 
1008  return FLObj;
1009  }
apfel::CG
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::report
void report(string const &what)
info
Definition: messages.cc:45
apfel::CNS
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::CS
Definition: disbasis.h:23
apfel::eps8
const double eps8
Definition: constants.h:29

◆ InitializeFLNCObjectsMassiveZero()

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeFLNCObjectsMassiveZero ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Masses,
double const &  IntEps,
int const &  nxi,
double const &  ximin,
double const &  ximax,
int const &  intdeg,
double const &  lambda 
)

Definition at line 1187 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

1195  {
1196  Timer t;
1197 
1198  // Determine number of active flavours
1199  int actnf = 0;
1200  for (auto const& m : Masses)
1201  if (m < eps8)
1202  actnf++;
1203 
1204  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for FL NC Massive Zero with " + to_string(actnf) + " active flavours... \n");
1205 
1206  // ===============================================================
1207  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
1208 
1209  // Zero Mass coefficient functions
1210  // LO
1211  map<int,Operator> CLLO;
1212  CLLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
1213  CLLO.insert({CS, Zero});
1214  CLLO.insert({CG, Zero});
1215 
1216  // NLO
1217  map<int,Operator> CLNLO;
1218  const Operator OL1ns{g, CL1ns{}, IntEps};
1219  const Operator OL1g {g, CL1g{}, IntEps};
1220  CLNLO.insert({CNS, OL1ns});
1221  CLNLO.insert({CS, OL1ns});
1222  CLNLO.insert({CG, OL1g});
1223 
1224  // NNLO
1225  const Operator OL2ps {g, CL2ps{}, IntEps};
1226  const Operator OL2g {g, CL2g{}, IntEps};
1227  const Operator OL2nsp{g, CL2nsp{actnf}, IntEps};
1228  const Operator OL2t = OL2nsp + 6 * OL2ps;
1229 
1230  // Massive zero coefficient functions
1231  // Null set of operator needed for the LO coefficient functions.
1232  map<int,Operator> Not;
1233  Not.insert({CNS, Zero});
1234  Not.insert({CS, Zero});
1235  Not.insert({CG, Zero});
1236 
1237  // Initialize massive zero coefficient functions
1238  const Operator Om0L1g {g, Cm0L1gNC_c{}, IntEps};
1239  const Operator Om0L2nsc{g, Cm0L2nsNC_c{}, IntEps};
1240  const Operator Om0L2nsl{g, Cm0L2nsNC_l{}, IntEps};
1241  const Operator Om0L2psc{g, Cm0L2psNC_c{}, IntEps};
1242  const Operator Om0L2psl{g, Cm0L2psNC_l{}, IntEps};
1243  const Operator Om0L2psf{g, Cm0L2psNC_f{}, IntEps};
1244  const Operator Om0L2gc {g, Cm0L2gNC_c{}, IntEps};
1245  const Operator Om0L2gl {g, Cm0L2gNC_l{}, IntEps};
1246  const Operator Om0L2gf {g, Cm0L2gNC_f{}, IntEps};
1247 
1248  // NNLO
1249  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2ns{[=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1250  {
1251  const double lxi = log(xi);
1252  return Om0L2nsc + lxi * Om0L2nsl;
1253  }, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1254  const auto fOL2s = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1255  {
1256  const double lxi = log(xi);
1257  const double lxiF = - lxi;
1258  return 6 * ( Om0L2psc + lxi * Om0L2psl + lxiF * Om0L2psf );
1259  };
1260  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2s{fOL2s, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1261  const auto fOL2g = [=,&g] (double const& xi) -> Operator
1262  {
1263  const double lxi = log(xi);
1264  const double lxiF = - lxi;
1265  return Om0L2gc + lxi * Om0L2gl + lxiF * Om0L2gf;
1266  };
1267  const TabulateObject<Operator> TabOL2g{fOL2g, nxi, ximin, ximax, intdeg, {}, lambda};
1268 
1269  // Vector of distributions to skip
1270  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
1271 
1272  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
1273  const auto FLObj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
1274  {
1275  // Fill in structure function object
1276  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
1277  FObj.skip = skip;
1278 
1279  // Start with the heavy quark structure function components.
1280  const double Q2 = Q * Q;
1281  Operator lNNLOns = OL2nsp;
1282  for (int k = actnf + 1; k <= 6; k++)
1283  {
1284  // Compute value of xi.
1285  const double M2 = Masses[k-1] * Masses[k-1];
1286  const double xi = Q2 / M2;
1287 
1288  // Convolution Basis
1289  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
1290 
1291  // Set LO non-singlet and singlet coefficient
1292  // functions to zero (gluon is already zero).
1293  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),Not}});
1294 
1295  // Now insert NLO
1296  map<int,Operator> NLO;
1297  NLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
1298  NLO.insert({CS, Zero});
1299  NLO.insert({CG, Om0L1g});
1300  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NLO}});
1301 
1302  // Now insert NNLO
1303  map<int,Operator> NNLO;
1304  NNLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
1305  NNLO.insert({CS, TabOL2s.Evaluate(xi)});
1306  NNLO.insert({CG, TabOL2g.Evaluate(xi)});
1307  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k),NNLO}});
1308 
1309  // Include the massive bit to the non-singlet coefficient
1310  // function needed for the light structure functions.
1311  for (int i = 0; i <= actnf; i++)
1312  lNNLOns += TabOL2ns.Evaluate(xi);
1313  }
1314 
1315  // Now fill in the light components. To be updated in the
1316  // loop over the heavy component.
1317  map<int,Operator> CLNNLO;
1318  CLNNLO.insert({CNS, lNNLOns});
1319  CLNNLO.insert({CS, OL2t});
1320  CLNNLO.insert({CG, OL2g});
1321  for (int k = 1; k <= actnf; k++)
1322  {
1323  // Convolution Basis
1324  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k, DISNCBasis{k, Ch[k-1]}});
1325  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLLO}});
1326  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNLO}});
1327  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNNLO}});
1328  }
1329 
1330  // Total structure function set to zero for now. Need to
1331  // construct it a posteriori as a sum of light and heavy
1332  // components.
1333  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({0, DISNCBasis{Ch}});
1334  FObj.C0.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1335  FObj.C1.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1336  FObj.C2.insert({0,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(0), Not}});
1337  return FObj;
1338  };
1339  t.stop();
1340 
1341  return FLObj;
1342  }

function<StructureFunctionObjects(double const&, vector<double> const&)> apfel::InitializeFLNCObjectsZM ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Definition at line 98 of file structurefunctionbuilder.cc.

101  {
102  report("Initializing StructureFunctionObjects for FL NC Zero Mass... ");
103  Timer t;
104 
105  // ===============================================================
106  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
107 
108  // LO
109  map<int,Operator> CLLO;
110  CLLO.insert({CNS, Zero});
111  CLLO.insert({CS, Zero});
112  CLLO.insert({CG, Zero});
113 
114  // NLO
115  map<int,Operator> CLNLO;
116  const Operator OL1ns{g, CL1ns{}, IntEps};
117  const Operator OL1g {g, CL1g{}, IntEps};
118  CLNLO.insert({CNS, OL1ns});
119  CLNLO.insert({CS, OL1ns});
120  CLNLO.insert({CG, OL1g});
121 
122  // NNLO (for nf from 1 to 6)
123  map<int,map<int,Operator>> CLNNLO;
124  const Operator OL2ps{g, CL2ps{}, IntEps};
125  const Operator OL2g {g, CL2g{}, IntEps};
126  for (int nf = 1; nf <= 6; nf++)
127  {
128  const Operator OL2nsp{g, CL2nsp{nf}, IntEps};
129  const Operator OL2t = OL2nsp + 6 * OL2ps;
130  map<int,Operator> CLNNLOnf;
131  CLNNLOnf.insert({CNS, OL2nsp});
132  CLNNLOnf.insert({CS, OL2t});
133  CLNNLOnf.insert({CG, OL2g});
134  CLNNLO.insert({nf,CLNNLOnf});
135  }
136 
137  // Vector of distributions to skip
138  const vector<int> skip = {2,4,6,8,10,12};
139 
140  // Define object of the structure containing the DglapObjects
141  const auto FLObj = [=] (double const& Q, vector<double> const& Ch) -> StructureFunctionObjects
142  {
143  // Determine number of active flavours.
144  const int nf = NF(Q, Thresholds);
145 
146  // Effective charges. The charges of the components with mh >
147  // Q are set to zero.
148  vector<double> EffCh;
149  for (int k = 1; k <= 6; k++)
150  EffCh.push_back(( k > nf ? 0 : Ch[k-1]));
151 
152  // Fill in structure function object
153  StructureFunctionObjects FObj;
154  FObj.skip = skip;
155  // Single structure function components.
156  for (int k = 0; k <= 6; k++)
157  {
158  FObj.ConvBasis.insert({k,(k == 0 ? DISNCBasis{EffCh} : DISNCBasis{k, EffCh[k-1]})});
159  FObj.C0.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLLO}});
160  FObj.C1.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNLO}});
161  FObj.C2.insert({k,Set<Operator>{FObj.ConvBasis.at(k), CLNNLO.at(nf)}});
162  }
163  return FObj;
164  };
165  t.stop();
166 
167  return FLObj;
168  }

apfel::NF
int NF(double const &Q, vector< double > const &Thresholds)
Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds...

◆ InitializeTmdObjects()

map< int, TmdObjects > apfel::InitializeTmdObjects ( Grid const &  g,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  IntEps = 1e-5 
)

The ComputeMatchingFunctions precomputes the constant (i.e. non-logaritmic) perturbative coefficients of the matching functions to match PDFs/FFs on the respective TMDs at small values of bT.

Parameters
gthe x grid
Thresholds
IntEpsthe integration accuracy
Returns

Definition at line 25 of file tmdbuilder.cc.

28  {
29  report("Initializing TMD objects for matching and evolution... ");
30  Timer t;
31 
32  // Compute initial and final number of active flavours according
33  // to the vector of thresholds (it assumes that the thresholds
34  // vector entries are ordered).
35  int nfi = 0;
36  int nff = Thresholds.size();
37  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
38  if (v <= 0)
39  nfi++;
40 
41  // ===============================================================
42  // LO matching functions operators.
43  map<int,Operator> MatchLO;
44  const Operator Id {g, Identity{}, IntEps};
45  const Operator Zero{g, Null{}, IntEps};
46  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, Id});
47  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, Id});
48  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, Id});
49  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, Id});
50  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, Zero});
51  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, Zero});
52  MatchLO.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, Id});
53 
54  // ===============================================================
55  // NLO matching functions operators.
56  // PDFs
57  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchPDFsNLO;
58  const Operator O1ns{g, C1ns{}, IntEps};
59  const Operator O1qg{g, C1qg{}, IntEps};
60  const Operator O1gq{g, C1gq{}, IntEps};
61  const Operator O1gg{g, C1gg{}, IntEps};
62  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
63  {
64  const Operator O1qgnf = nf * O1qg;
65  map<int,Operator> OM;
66  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1ns});
67  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1ns});
68  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1ns});
69  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1ns});
70  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O1qgnf});
71  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O1gq});
72  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O1gg});
73  MatchPDFsNLO.insert({nf,OM});
74  }
75 
76  // FFs
77  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchFFsNLO;
78  const Operator O1nsff{g, C1nsff{}, IntEps};
79  const Operator O1qgff{g, C1qgff{}, IntEps};
80  const Operator O1gqff{g, C1gqff{}, IntEps};
81  const Operator O1ggff{g, C1ggff{}, IntEps};
82  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
83  {
84  const Operator O1qgffnf = nf * O1qgff;
85  map<int,Operator> OM;
86  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O1nsff});
87  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O1nsff});
88  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O1nsff});
89  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O1nsff});
90  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O1qgffnf});
91  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O1gqff});
92  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O1ggff});
93  MatchFFsNLO.insert({nf,OM});
94  }
95 
96  // ===============================================================
97  // NNLO matching functions operators.
98  // PDFs
99  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchPDFsNNLO;
100  const Operator O2Vqqb{g, C2Vqqb{}, IntEps};
101  const Operator O2ps{g, C2ps{}, IntEps};
102  const Operator O2qg{g, C2qg{}, IntEps};
103  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
104  {
105  const Operator O2Vqq{g, C2Vqq{nf}, IntEps};
106  const Operator O2qgnf = nf * O2qg;
107  const Operator O2gq{g, C2gq{nf}, IntEps};
108  const Operator O2gg{g, C2gg{nf}, IntEps};
109  const Operator O2nsp = O2Vqq + O2Vqqb;
110  const Operator O2nsm = O2Vqq - O2Vqqb;
111  const Operator O2qq = O2nsp + nf * O2ps;
112  map<int,Operator> OM;
113  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O2nsp});
114  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O2nsm});
115  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O2nsm});
116  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O2qq});
117  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O2qgnf});
118  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O2gq});
119  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O2gg});
120  MatchPDFsNNLO.insert({nf,OM});
121  }
122 
123  // FFs
124  map<int,map<int,Operator>> MatchFFsNNLO;
125  const Operator O2Vqqbff{g, C2Vqqbff{}, IntEps};
126  const Operator O2psff{g, C2psff{}, IntEps};
127  const Operator O2qgff{g, C2qgff{}, IntEps};
128  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
129  {
130  const Operator O2Vqqff{g, C2Vqqff{nf}, IntEps};
131  const Operator O2qgffnf = nf * O2qgff;
132  const Operator O2gqff{g, C2gqff{nf}, IntEps};
133  const Operator O2ggff{g, C2ggff{nf}, IntEps};
134  const Operator O2nspff = O2Vqqff + O2Vqqbff;
135  const Operator O2nsmff = O2Vqqff - O2Vqqbff;
136  const Operator O2qqff = O2nspff + nf * O2psff;
137  map<int,Operator> OM;
138  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, O2nspff});
139  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, O2nsmff});
140  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, O2nsmff});
141  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, O2qqff});
142  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, O2qgffnf});
143  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, O2gqff});
144  OM.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, O2ggff});
145  MatchFFsNNLO.insert({nf,OM});
146  }
147 
148  // Define map containing the TmdObjects for each nf.
149  map<int,TmdObjects> TmdObj;
150 
151  // Construct sets of operators for each perturbative order for the
152  // matching functions. Initialize also coefficients of: beta
153  // function, GammaCusp, gammaV, and Collins-Soper anomalous
154  // dimensions.
155  map<int,map<int,Set<Operator>>> MatchingFunctionsPDFs;
156  for (int nf = nfi; nf <= nff; nf++)
157  {
158  TmdObjects obj;
159 
160  // Threshold
161  obj.Threshold = Thresholds[nf-1];
162 
163  // Beta function
164  obj.Beta.insert({0, beta0(nf)});
165  obj.Beta.insert({1, beta1(nf)});
166  obj.Beta.insert({2, beta2(nf)});
167 
168  // GammaCusp
169  obj.GammaCuspq.insert({0, 4 * CF * GammaCusp0()});
170  obj.GammaCuspq.insert({1, 4 * CF * GammaCusp1(nf)});
171  obj.GammaCuspq.insert({2, 4 * CF * GammaCusp2(nf)});
172  obj.GammaCuspg.insert({0, 4 * CA * GammaCusp0()});
173  obj.GammaCuspg.insert({1, 4 * CA * GammaCusp1(nf)});
174  obj.GammaCuspg.insert({2, 4 * CA * GammaCusp2(nf)});
175 
176  // GammaV
177  obj.GammaVq.insert({0, gammaVq0()});
178  obj.GammaVq.insert({1, gammaVq1(nf)});
179  obj.GammaVq.insert({2, gammaVq2(nf)});
180  obj.GammaVg.insert({0, gammaVg0(nf)});
181  obj.GammaVg.insert({1, gammaVg1(nf)});
182  obj.GammaVg.insert({2, gammaVg2(nf)});
183 
184  // CSd
185  valarray<double> d1{CSd10(), CSd11()};
186  valarray<double> d2{CSd20(nf), CSd21(nf), CSd22(nf)};
187  valarray<double> d3{CSd30(nf), CSd31(nf), CSd32(nf), CSd33(nf)};
188  obj.CSdq.insert({0, CF * d1});
189  obj.CSdq.insert({1, CF * d2});
190  obj.CSdq.insert({2, CF * d3});
191  obj.CSdg.insert({0, CA * d1});
192  obj.CSdg.insert({1, CA * d2});
193  obj.CSdg.insert({2, CA * d3});
194 
195  // Log(zeta) coefficients (for implementing the zeta-
196  // prescription)
197  obj.Lzetaq.insert({0, {Lzetaq10(), Lzetaq11()}});
198  obj.Lzetaq.insert({1, {Lzetaq20(nf), 0, Lzetaq22(nf)}});
199  obj.Lzetag.insert({0, {Lzetag10(nf), Lzetag11()}});
200  obj.Lzetag.insert({1, {Lzetag20(nf), 0, Lzetag22(nf)}});
201 
202  // Matching functions.
203  const EvolutionBasisQCD evb{nf};
204  obj.MatchingFunctionsPDFs.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchLO}});
205  obj.MatchingFunctionsPDFs.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchPDFsNLO.at(nf)}});
206  obj.MatchingFunctionsPDFs.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchPDFsNNLO.at(nf)}});
207 
208  obj.MatchingFunctionsFFs.insert({0, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchLO}});
209  obj.MatchingFunctionsFFs.insert({1, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchFFsNLO.at(nf)}});
210  obj.MatchingFunctionsFFs.insert({2, Set<Operator>{evb, MatchFFsNNLO.at(nf)}});
211 
212  TmdObj.insert({nf, obj});
213  }
214  t.stop();
215 
216  return TmdObj;
217  }

LO coefficient of the QCD function.

apfel::CSd20

◆ LHToyPDFs()

map<int,double> apfel::LHToyPDFs ( double const &  x,
double const &   
)

Definition at line 27 of file lhtoypdfs.h.

28  {
29  // Call all functions only once.
30  const double upv = xupv (x);
31  const double dnv = xdnv (x);
32  const double glu = xglu (x);
33  const double dbar = xdbar(x);
34  const double ubar = xubar(x);
35  const double sbar = xsbar(x);
36 
37  // Construct QCD evolution basis conbinations.
38  double const Gluon = glu;
39  double const Singlet = dnv + 2 * dbar + upv + 2 * ubar + 2 * sbar;
40  double const T3 = upv + 2 * ubar - dnv - 2 * dbar;
41  double const T8 = upv + 2 * ubar + dnv + 2 * dbar - 4 * sbar;
42  double const Valence = upv + dnv;
43  double const V3 = upv - dnv;
44 
45  // Fill in map in the QCD evolution basis.
46  map<int,double> QCDEvMap;
47  QCDEvMap[0] = Gluon;
48  QCDEvMap[1] = Singlet;
49  QCDEvMap[2] = Valence;
50  QCDEvMap[3] = T3;
51  QCDEvMap[4] = V3;
52  QCDEvMap[5] = T8;
53  QCDEvMap[6] = Valence;
54  QCDEvMap[7] = Singlet;
55  QCDEvMap[8] = Valence;
56  QCDEvMap[9] = Singlet;
57  QCDEvMap[10] = Valence;
58  QCDEvMap[11] = Singlet;
59  QCDEvMap[12] = Valence;
60 
61  return QCDEvMap;
62  }

◆ MatchingConditions()

function<Set<Operator>bool const&, int const&)> apfel::MatchingConditions ( map< int, DglapObjects > const &  DglapObj,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas 
)

Definition at line 808 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

811  {
812  // Compute coupling above and below the thresholds.
813  map<int,double> asThUp;
814  map<int,double> asThDown;
815  for (auto obj = std::next(DglapObj.begin()); obj != DglapObj.end(); ++obj)
816  {
817  const int nf = obj->first;
818  const double thr = obj->second.Threshold;
819  asThDown.insert({nf,Alphas(thr*(1-eps8))/FourPi});
820  asThUp.insert({nf,Alphas(thr*(1+eps8))/FourPi});
821  }
822 
823  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
824  return [=] (bool const&, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
825  {
826  return DglapObj.at(nf).MatchingConditions.at(0);
827  };
828  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
829  return [=] (bool const& Up, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
830  {
831  const double cp = ( Up ? asThUp.at(nf+1) : asThDown.at(nf+1) );
832  const auto mc = DglapObj.at(nf).MatchingConditions;
833  return mc.at(0) + ( Up ? 1 : -1) * cp * mc.at(1);
834  };
835  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
836  return [=] (bool const& Up, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
837  {
838  const double cp = ( Up ? asThUp.at(nf+1) : asThDown.at(nf+1) );
839  const auto mc = DglapObj.at(nf).MatchingConditions;
840  return mc.at(0) + ( Up ? 1 : -1) * cp * ( mc.at(1) + cp * mc.at(2) );
841  };
842  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 3)
843  return [=] (bool const& Up, int const& nf) -> Set<Operator>
844  {
845  const double cp = ( Up ? asThUp.at(nf+1) : asThDown.at(nf+1) );
846  const auto mc = DglapObj.at(nf).MatchingConditions;
847  return mc.at(0) + ( Up ? 1 : -1) * cp * ( mc.at(1) + cp * mc.at(2) );
848  };
849  else
850  throw runtime_error(error("MatchingConditions","Perturbative order not allowed."));
851  }

const double FourPi

◆ MatchTmdFFs()

function< Set< Distribution >double const &)> apfel::MatchTmdFFs ( map< int, TmdObjects > const &  TmdObj,
map< int, DglapObjects > const &  DglapObj,
function< Set< Distribution >(double const &)> const &  CollFFs,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Mub,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas 
)

Function that returns the matched TMD FFs in b-space as functions of the initial scale. It assumes the zeta-prescription.

Definition at line 387 of file tmdbuilder.cc.

393  {
394  // Retrieve thresholds from "TmdObj".
395  vector<double> thrs;
396  for(auto const& obj : TmdObj)
397  {
398  const int nf = obj.first;
399  const double thr = obj.second.Threshold;
400  if ((int) thrs.size() < nf)
401  thrs.resize(nf);
402  thrs[nf-1] = thr;
403  }
404 
405  // Define the LX fuction as in eq. (4.9) of arXiv:1604.07869.
406  const double C0 = 2 * exp(- emc);
407  const auto LX = [C0] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double{ return 2 * log( b * mu / C0 ); };
408 
409  // Matching functions as functions of the absolute value of the
410  // impact parameter b.
411  function<Set<Operator>(double const&)> MatchFunc;
412  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
413  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
414  {
415  return TmdObj.at(NF(Mub(b),thrs)).MatchingFunctionsFFs.at(0);
416  };
417  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
418  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
419  {
420  const double mu = Mub(b);
421  const int nf = NF(mu,thrs);
422  const auto mf = TmdObj.at(nf).MatchingFunctionsFFs;
423  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
424  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
425  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
426  return mf.at(0) + coup * ( - Lmu * sf.at(0) + mf.at(1) );
427  };
428  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
429  {
430  // Precompute set of operators on the O(as^2) bit that are
431  // proportional to the different powers of Lmu (see eq. (2.37)
432  // of https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.01473.pdf).
433  map<int,Set<Operator>> SetLcoef;
434  map<int,Set<Operator>> SetL2coef;
435  for (auto const& to : TmdObj)
436  {
437  const int nf = to.first;
438  const double b0 = to.second.Beta.at(0);
439  const auto mf = to.second.MatchingFunctionsFFs;
440  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
441 
442  // Construct matricial product of P0 * P0 and C1 * P0 (see
443  // eq. (B.15) https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.01473.pdf).
444  const auto P0 = sf.at(0);
445  const auto P1 = sf.at(1);
446  const auto C1 = mf.at(1);
447  const auto ConvMap = P0.GetMap();
448 
449  map<int,Operator> MapL2coef;
450  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, ( P0.at(0) * P0.at(0) - b0 * P0.at(0) ) / 2});
451  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, ( P0.at(1) * P0.at(1) - b0 * P0.at(1) ) / 2});
452  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, ( P0.at(2) * P0.at(2) - b0 * P0.at(2) ) / 2});
453  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, ( P0.at(3) * P0.at(3) + P0.at(4) * P0.at(5) - b0 * P0.at(3) ) / 2});
454  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, ( P0.at(3) * P0.at(4) + P0.at(4) * P0.at(6) - b0 * P0.at(4) ) / 2});
455  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, ( P0.at(5) * P0.at(3) + P0.at(6) * P0.at(5) - b0 * P0.at(5) ) / 2});
456  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, ( P0.at(5) * P0.at(4) + P0.at(6) * P0.at(6) - b0 * P0.at(6) ) / 2});
457 
458  map<int,Operator> MapLcoef;
459  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, P1.at(0) + C1.at(0) * P0.at(0) - b0 * C1.at(0)});
460  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, P1.at(1) + C1.at(1) * P0.at(1) - b0 * C1.at(1)});
461  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, P1.at(2) + C1.at(2) * P0.at(2) - b0 * C1.at(2)});
462  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, P1.at(3) + C1.at(3) * P0.at(3) + C1.at(4) * P0.at(5) - b0 * C1.at(3)});
463  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, P1.at(4) + C1.at(3) * P0.at(4) + C1.at(4) * P0.at(6) - b0 * C1.at(4)});
464  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, P1.at(5) + C1.at(5) * P0.at(3) + C1.at(6) * P0.at(5) - b0 * C1.at(5)});
465  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, P1.at(6) + C1.at(5) * P0.at(4) + C1.at(6) * P0.at(6) - b0 * C1.at(6)});
466 
467  SetL2coef.insert({nf,Set<Operator>{ConvMap, MapL2coef}});
468  SetLcoef.insert({nf,Set<Operator>{ConvMap, MapLcoef}});
469  }
470 
471  // Now contruct the actual matching-function function.
472  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
473  {
474  const double mu = Mub(b);
475  const int nf = NF(mu,thrs);
476  const auto mf = TmdObj.at(nf).MatchingFunctionsFFs;
477  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
478  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
479  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
480  const auto nlo = mf.at(1) - Lmu * sf.at(0);
481  const auto nnlo = mf.at(2) - Lmu * ( SetLcoef.at(nf) - Lmu * SetL2coef.at(nf) );
482  return mf.at(0) + coup * ( nlo + coup * nnlo );
483  };
484  }
485 
486  // Construct function that returns the product of matching
487  // functions and collinear FFs.
488  const auto MatchedTMDs = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
489  {
490  return MatchFunc(b) * CollFFs(Mub(b));
491  };
492 
493  return MatchedTMDs;
494  }
apfel::FourPi
const double FourPi
Definition: constants.h:51
apfel::emc
const double emc
Definition: constants.h:52

Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds...

283  {
284  // Retrieve thresholds from "TmdObj".
285  vector<double> thrs;

287  {
288  const int nf = obj.first;
289  const double thr = obj.second.Threshold;
290  if ((int) thrs.size() < nf)

292  thrs[nf-1] = thr;
293  }
294 
295  // Define the LX fuction as in eq. (4.9) of arXiv:1604.07869.
296  const double C0 = 2 * exp(- emc);
297  const auto LX = [C0] (double const& mu, double const& b) -> double{ return 2 * log( b * mu / C0 ); };
298 
299  // Matching functions as functions of the absolute value of the
300  // impact parameter b.
301  function<Set<Operator>(double const&)> MatchFunc;
302  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
303  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
304  {
305  return TmdObj.at(NF(Mub(b),thrs)).MatchingFunctionsPDFs.at(0);
306  };
307  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
308  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
309  {
310  const double mu = Mub(b);
311  const int nf = NF(mu,thrs);
312  const auto mf = TmdObj.at(nf).MatchingFunctionsPDFs;
313  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
314  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
315  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
316  return mf.at(0) + coup * ( - Lmu * sf.at(0) + mf.at(1) );
317  };
318  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
319  {
320  // Precompute set of operators on the O(as^2) bit that are
321  // proportional to the different powers of Lmu (see eq. (2.37)
322  // of https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.01473.pdf).

325  for (auto const& to : TmdObj)
326  {
327  const int nf = to.first;
328  const double b0 = to.second.Beta.at(0);
329  const auto mf = to.second.MatchingFunctionsPDFs;
330  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
331 
332  // Construct matricial product of P0 * P0 and C1 * P0 (see
333  // eq. (B.15) https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.01473.pdf).
334  const auto P0 = sf.at(0);
335  const auto P1 = sf.at(1);
336  const auto C1 = mf.at(1);
337  const auto ConvMap = P0.GetMap();
338 
339  map<int,Operator> MapL2coef;
340  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, ( P0.at(0) * P0.at(0) - b0 * P0.at(0) ) / 2});
341  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, ( P0.at(1) * P0.at(1) - b0 * P0.at(1) ) / 2});
342  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, ( P0.at(2) * P0.at(2) - b0 * P0.at(2) ) / 2});
343  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, ( P0.at(3) * P0.at(3) + P0.at(4) * P0.at(5) - b0 * P0.at(3) ) / 2});
344  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, ( P0.at(3) * P0.at(4) + P0.at(4) * P0.at(6) - b0 * P0.at(4) ) / 2});
345  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, ( P0.at(5) * P0.at(3) + P0.at(6) * P0.at(5) - b0 * P0.at(5) ) / 2});
346  MapL2coef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, ( P0.at(5) * P0.at(4) + P0.at(6) * P0.at(6) - b0 * P0.at(6) ) / 2});
347 
348  map<int,Operator> MapLcoef;
349  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSP, P1.at(0) + C1.at(0) * P0.at(0) - b0 * C1.at(0)});
350  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSM, P1.at(1) + C1.at(1) * P0.at(1) - b0 * C1.at(1)});
351  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PNSV, P1.at(2) + C1.at(2) * P0.at(2) - b0 * C1.at(2)});
352  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQQ, P1.at(3) + C1.at(3) * P0.at(3) + C1.at(4) * P0.at(5) - b0 * C1.at(3)});
353  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PQG, P1.at(4) + C1.at(3) * P0.at(4) + C1.at(4) * P0.at(6) - b0 * C1.at(4)});
354  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGQ, P1.at(5) + C1.at(5) * P0.at(3) + C1.at(6) * P0.at(5) - b0 * C1.at(5)});
355  MapLcoef.insert({EvolutionBasisQCD::PGG, P1.at(6) + C1.at(5) * P0.at(4) + C1.at(6) * P0.at(6) - b0 * C1.at(6)});
356 
357  SetL2coef.insert({nf,Set<Operator>{ConvMap, MapL2coef}});
358  SetLcoef.insert({nf,Set<Operator>{ConvMap, MapLcoef}});
359  }
360 
361  // Now contruct the actual matching-function function.
362  MatchFunc = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Operator>
363  {
364  const double mu = Mub(b);
365  const int nf = NF(mu,thrs);
366  const auto mf = TmdObj.at(nf).MatchingFunctionsPDFs;
367  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
368  const double Lmu = LX(mu,b);
369  const double coup = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
370  const auto nlo = mf.at(1) - Lmu * sf.at(0);
371  const auto nnlo = mf.at(2) - Lmu * ( SetLcoef.at(nf) - Lmu * SetL2coef.at(nf) );
372  return mf.at(0) + coup * ( nlo + coup * nnlo );
373  };
374  }
375 
376  // Construct function that returns the product of matching
377  // functions and collinear FFs.
378  const auto MatchedTMDs = [=] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
379  {
380  return MatchFunc(b) * CollPDFs(Mub(b));
381  };
382 
383  return MatchedTMDs;
384  }

◆ NF()

int apfel::NF ( double const &  Q,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds 
)

Return the number of active flavours at the scale Q given the (ordered) vector of thresholds.

Parameters
Qscale
Thresholds
Returns
number of active flavours

Definition at line 13 of file tools.cc.

14  {
15  // Compute number of active flavours the the PDF initial scale
16  int nf = 0;
17  for (auto const& v : Thresholds)
18  if (Q > v)
19  nf++;
20  else
21  break;
22  return nf;
23  }

◆ OgataQuadrature()

double apfel::OgataQuadrature ( function< double(double const &)> const &  func,
double const &  qT,
double const &  CutOff,
double const &  h 
)

Function that performs the Hankel-transform of the input function using the Ogata quadrature method described here: http://www.kurims.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~okamoto/paper/Publ_RIMS_DE/41-4-40.pdf.

Definition at line 17 of file ogataquadrature.cc.

18  {
19  // Define helper functions.
20  const auto psi = [] (double const& t)->double{ return t * tanh( M_PI * sinh(t) / 2 ); };
21  const auto psip = [] (double const& t)->double{ return ( M_PI * t * cosh(t) + sinh( M_PI * sinh(t) ) ) / ( 1 + cosh( M_PI * sinh(t) ) ); };
22 
23  // Number of terms counter.
24  int i = 0;
25 
26  // Run over the zeros of J0. There are 1000 precomputed zeros.
27  // This should be enough for all practical applications.
28  double integral = 0;
29  for (auto const& jz : j0Zeros)
30  {
31  i++;
32  const double w = y0(jz) / j1(jz);
33  const double z = jz / M_PI;
34  const double x = M_PI * psi( h * z ) / h;
35  const double f = x * func( x / qT ) / 2;
36  const double term = f * j0(x) * psip( h * z );
37 
38  // Break when the absolute value of the last term is less
39  // than "CutOff". This assumes that terms are increasingly
40  // small. Provided that the integrand is not badly behaved,
41  // this should be guaranteed by the Bessel function j0.
42  if (abs(term/integral) < CutOff)
43  break;
44 
45  integral += w * term;
46  }
47  integral *= M_PI / qT / qT;
48 
49  // If the number of terms is equal to the size of the "j0Zeros"
50  // vector give a warning.
51  if (i == (int) j0Zeros.size())
52  warning("OgataQuadrature", "Number of j0 zero's available exceeded: the integration might not have converged.");
53 
54  return integral;
55  }
apfel::warning
void warning(string const &tag, string const &what)
warning
Definition: messages.cc:59
apfel::j0Zeros
const vector< double > j0Zeros
Definition: ogataquadrature.h:21

◆ PhysToQCDEv()

map< int, double > apfel::PhysToQCDEv ( map< int, double > const &  InPhysMap)

Collection of funcitions to rotate distributions from one basis to the other.

Definition at line 23 of file rotations.cc.

24  {
25  // Call function in the physical basis.
26  map<int,double> PhysMap = InPhysMap;
27 
28  // Fill in keys that don't exist.
29  // Gluon (assumes that the ID is 21).
30  if (PhysMap.find(0) == PhysMap.end())
31  PhysMap[0] = PhysMap[21];
32 
33  // Quarks (Fill in with zero if they don't exist).
34  for (int i = -6; i <= 6; i++)
35  if (PhysMap.find(i) == PhysMap.end())
36  PhysMap[i] = 0;
37 
38  // Fill in map in the QCD evolution basis. It attumes that the
39  // gluon has key zero and all keys from -6 to 6 exist.
40  map<int,double> QCDEvMap;
41  QCDEvMap[0] = PhysMap.at(0);
42  QCDEvMap[1] =
43  + PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1)
44  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
45  + PhysMap.at(3) + PhysMap.at(-3)
46  + PhysMap.at(4) + PhysMap.at(-4)
47  + PhysMap.at(5) + PhysMap.at(-5)
48  + PhysMap.at(6) + PhysMap.at(-6);
49  QCDEvMap[2] =
50  + PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1)
51  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
52  + PhysMap.at(3) - PhysMap.at(-3)
53  + PhysMap.at(4) - PhysMap.at(-4)
54  + PhysMap.at(5) - PhysMap.at(-5)
55  + PhysMap.at(6) - PhysMap.at(-6);
56  QCDEvMap[3] =
57  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
58  - ( PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1) );
59  QCDEvMap[4] =
60  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
61  - ( PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1) );
62  QCDEvMap[5] =
63  + PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1)
64  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
65  - 2 * ( PhysMap.at(3) + PhysMap.at(-3) );
66  QCDEvMap[6] =
67  + PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1)
68  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
69  - 2 * ( PhysMap.at(3) - PhysMap.at(-3) );
70  QCDEvMap[7] =
71  + PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1)
72  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
73  + PhysMap.at(3) + PhysMap.at(-3)
74  - 3 * ( PhysMap.at(4) + PhysMap.at(-4) );
75  QCDEvMap[8] =
76  + PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1)
77  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
78  + PhysMap.at(3) - PhysMap.at(-3)
79  - 3 * ( PhysMap.at(4) - PhysMap.at(-4) );
80  QCDEvMap[9] =
81  + PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1)
82  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
83  + PhysMap.at(3) + PhysMap.at(-3)
84  + PhysMap.at(4) + PhysMap.at(-4)
85  - 4 * ( PhysMap.at(5) + PhysMap.at(-5) );
86  QCDEvMap[10] =
87  + PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1)
88  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
89  + PhysMap.at(3) - PhysMap.at(-3)
90  + PhysMap.at(4) - PhysMap.at(-4)
91  - 4 * ( PhysMap.at(5) - PhysMap.at(-5) );
92  QCDEvMap[11] =
93  + PhysMap.at(1) + PhysMap.at(-1)
94  + PhysMap.at(2) + PhysMap.at(-2)
95  + PhysMap.at(3) + PhysMap.at(-3)
96  + PhysMap.at(4) + PhysMap.at(-4)
97  + PhysMap.at(5) + PhysMap.at(-5)
98  - 5 * ( PhysMap.at(6) + PhysMap.at(-6) );
99  QCDEvMap[12] =
100  + PhysMap.at(1) - PhysMap.at(-1)
101  + PhysMap.at(2) - PhysMap.at(-2)
102  + PhysMap.at(3) - PhysMap.at(-3)
103  + PhysMap.at(4) - PhysMap.at(-4)
104  + PhysMap.at(5) - PhysMap.at(-5)
105  - 5 * ( PhysMap.at(6) - PhysMap.at(-6) );
106 
107  return QCDEvMap;
108  }

◆ QCDEvToPhys() [1/2]

map< int, double > apfel::QCDEvToPhys ( map< int, double > const &  QCDEvMap)

Definition at line 111 of file rotations.cc.

112  {
113  // Fill in map in the physical basis. It attumes that the gluon
114  // has key zero and all keys from 0 to 12 exist.
115  map<int,double> PhysMap;
116  PhysMap[0] = QCDEvMap.at(0);
117  PhysMap[21] = QCDEvMap.at(0);
118 
119  // Perform the rotation.
120  for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++)
121  {
122  PhysMap[i] = 0;
123  PhysMap[-i] = 0;
124  for (int j = 1; j <= 6; j++)
125  {
126  PhysMap[i] += RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][j-1] * ( QCDEvMap.at(2*j-1) + QCDEvMap.at(2*j) );
127  PhysMap[-i] += RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][j-1] * ( QCDEvMap.at(2*j-1) - QCDEvMap.at(2*j) );
128  }
129  }
130  return PhysMap;
131  }
apfel::RotQCDEvToPhys
const double RotQCDEvToPhys[6][6]
Definition: rotations.cc:15

◆ QCDEvToPhys() [2/2]

map< int, Distribution > apfel::QCDEvToPhys ( map< int, Distribution > const &  QCDEvMap)

Definition at line 134 of file rotations.cc.

135  {
136  // Fill in map in the physical basis. It attumes that the gluon
137  // has key zero and all keys from 0 to 12 exist.
138  map<int,Distribution> PhysMap;
139  PhysMap.insert({0,QCDEvMap.at(0)});
140  PhysMap.insert({0,QCDEvMap.at(0)});
141 
142  // Perform the rotation.
143  for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++)
144  {
145  Distribution Td = RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][0] * ( QCDEvMap.at(1) + QCDEvMap.at(2) );
146  Distribution Vd = RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][0] * ( QCDEvMap.at(1) - QCDEvMap.at(2) );
147  for (int j = 2; j <= 6; j++)
148  {
149  Td += RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][j-1] * ( QCDEvMap.at(2*j-1) + QCDEvMap.at(2*j) );
150  Vd += RotQCDEvToPhys[i-1][j-1] * ( QCDEvMap.at(2*j-1) - QCDEvMap.at(2*j) );
151  }
152  PhysMap.insert({i,Td});
153  PhysMap.insert({-i,Vd});
154  }
155  return PhysMap;
156  }

◆ rk1()

template<class U >
function<U(double const&, U const&, double const&)> apfel::rk1 ( function< U(double const &t, U const &Obj)> const &  f)

rk1 first order RK method using lambdas.

Definition at line 56 of file ode.h.

57  {
58  return [f](double const& t, U const& y, double const& dt) -> U{ return dt * f(t, y); } ;
59  }

◆ rk4()

template<class U >
function<U(double const&, U const&, double const&)> apfel::rk4 ( function< U(double const &t, U const &Obj)> const &  f)

rk4 fourth order RK method using lambdas, this solves:

dy / dt = f(t,y)

where:

dy = rk4(f(t,y))

so differentiation between lower and upper:

y += dy(t,y,dt)

U is the type of the 'y' object.

Definition at line 36 of file ode.h.

37  {
38  return
39  [ f ](double const& t, U const& y, double const& dt) -> U{ return
40  [t,y,dt,f ]( U const& dy1 ) -> U{ return
41  [t,y,dt,f,dy1 ]( U const& dy2 ) -> U{ return
42  [t,y,dt,f,dy1,dy2 ]( U const& dy3 ) -> U{ return
43  [t,y,dt,f,dy1,dy2,dy3]( U const& dy4 ) -> U{ return
44  ( dy1 + 2 * dy2 + 2 * dy3 + dy4 ) / 6 ;} (
45  dt * f( t + dt , y + dy3 ) );} (
46  dt * f( t + dt / 2, y + dy2 / 2 ) );} (
47  dt * f( t + dt / 2, y + dy1 / 2 ) );} (
48  dt * f( t , y ) );} ;
49  }

◆ SplittingFunctions()

function<Set<Operator>int const&, double const&)> apfel::SplittingFunctions ( map< int, DglapObjects > const &  DglapObj,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas 
)

Definition at line 772 of file dglapbuilder.cc.

775  {
776  if (PerturbativeOrder == 0)
777  return [=] (int const& nf, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
778  {
779  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
780  return cp * DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions.at(0);
781  };
782  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 1)
783  return [=] (int const& nf, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
784  {
785  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
786  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
787  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * sf.at(1) );
788  };
789  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 2)
790  return [=] (int const& nf, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
791  {
792  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
793  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
794  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * ( sf.at(1) + cp * sf.at(2) ) );
795  };
796  else if (PerturbativeOrder == 3)
797  return [=] (int const& nf, double const& mu) -> Set<Operator>
798  {
799  const double cp = Alphas(mu) / FourPi;
800  const auto sf = DglapObj.at(nf).SplittingFunctions;
801  return cp * ( sf.at(0) + cp * ( sf.at(1) + cp * ( sf.at(2) + cp * sf.at(3) ) ) );
802  };
803  else
804  throw runtime_error(error("SplittingFunctions","Perturbative order not allowed."));
805  }
apfel::FourPi
const double FourPi
Definition: constants.h:51
apfel::error
string error(string const &tag, string const &what)
error
Definition: messages.cc:66

◆ TmdCrossSectionDY() [1/2]

function<double(double const&)> apfel::TmdCrossSectionDY ( double const &  Vs,
double const &  Q,
double const &  y,
function< Set< Distribution >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &  EvolvedTMDPDFs,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
function< vector< double >(double const &)> const &  fEWCharges,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  cmuf,
double const &  czetaf 
)

Definition at line 20 of file tmdcrosssections.cc.

30  {
31  // Compute "muf" and "zetaf". They are assumed to be proportional
32  // to Q and Q^2, respectively, through "cmuf" and "czetaf".
33  const double muf = cmuf * Q;
34  const double zetaf = czetaf * Q * Q;
35 
36  // Compute values of x1 and x2.
37  const double x1 = Q * exp(-y) / Vs;
38  const double x2 = Q * exp(y) / Vs;
39 
40  // Get EW charges.
41  const vector<double> Bq = fEWCharges(Q);
42 
43  // Tabulate input TMDs in the impact parameter to make the
44  // integral faster.
45  const auto TabFunc = [] (double const& b) -> double{ return log(b); };
46  const auto InvTabFunc = [] (double const& fb) -> double{ return exp(fb); };
47  const TabulateObject<Set<Distribution>> TabulatedTMDs{[&] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
48  { return EvolvedTMDPDFs(b, muf, zetaf); }, 50, 5e-5, 30, 3, {}, TabFunc, InvTabFunc};
49 
50  // Construct the TMD luminosisty in b scale to be fed to be
51  // trasformed in qT space.
52  const auto TMDLumib = [=] (double const& b) -> double
53  {
54  // Get map of the TMDs in "x1" and "x2" and rotate them into the
55  // physical basis.
56  map<int,double> TMD1 = QCDEvToPhys(TabulatedTMDs.EvaluateMapxQ(x1, b));
57  map<int,double> TMD2 = QCDEvToPhys(TabulatedTMDs.EvaluateMapxQ(x2, b));
58 
59  // Construct the combination of TMDs weighted by the EW
60  // charges.
61  double lumi = 0;
62  for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++)
63  lumi += Bq[i-1] * ( TMD1[i] * TMD2[-i] + TMD1[-i] * TMD2[i] );
64 
65  // Divide by x1 and x2 because the "EvolvedTMDPDFs" function
66  // returns x times the TMDs.
67  lumi /= x1 * x2;
68 
69  return lumi;
70  };
71 
72  // Compute hard coefficient, including the other kinematic
73  // factors.
74  const double hcs = ConvFact * FourPi * HardCrossSectionDY(PerturbativeOrder, Alphas(muf), NF(muf, Thresholds), muf/Q) / 9 / pow(Vs*Q,2);
75 
76  return [TMDLumib,hcs,Q] (double const& qT) -> double
77  {
78  const double cutPref = 1 + pow(qT/Q,2) / 2;
79  return hcs * cutPref * OgataQuadrature(TMDLumib, qT);
80  // For test purposes, one can comment out the line above, in
81  // which the Ogata quadrature is used, and comment in the two
82  // lines below to use the DGauss quadrature. The second will
83  // be substantially slower but should return consistent
84  // results.
85  //const Integrator integrand{[=] (double const& bT) -> double{ return TMDLumib(bT) * j0(qT * bT) * bT / 2; }};
86  //return hcs * cutPref * integrand.integrate(0.00005,30,eps9);
87  };
88  }

◆ TmdCrossSectionDY() [2/2]

function<double(double const&)> apfel::TmdCrossSectionDY ( double const &  Vs,
double const &  Qmin,
double const &  Qmax,
double const &  ymin,
double const &  ymax,
function< Set< Distribution >(double const &)> const &  InTMDPDFs,
function< vector< double >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &  EvolFact,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
function< vector< double >(double const &)> const &  fEWCharges,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  cmuf,
double const &  czetaf,
double const &  IntEps 
)

Definition at line 165 of file tmdcrosssections.cc.

179  {
180  // Tabulation function and its inverse.
181  const auto TabFunc = [] (double const& b) -> double{ return log(b); };
182  const auto InvTabFunc = [] (double const& fb) -> double{ return exp(fb); };
183 
184  // Tabulate initial TMD PDFs.
185  const TabulateObject<Set<Distribution>> TabInTMDs{[&] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
186  { return InTMDPDFs(b); }, 50, 5e-5, 30, 3, {}, TabFunc, InvTabFunc};
187 
188  // If integration over Q and y is required, it is advantageous to
189  // perform these integrations before the integral over the impact
190  // parameter b (Fourier transform).
191  return [=] (double const& qT) -> double
192  {
193  const Integrator Qintegrand{
194  [&] (double const& lnQ) -> double
195  {
196  const double Q = exp(lnQ);
197  // Compute "muf" and "zetaf". They are assumed to be
198  // proportional to Q and Q^2, respectively, through
199  // "cmuf" and "czetaf".
200  const double muf = cmuf * Q;
201  const double zetaf = czetaf * Q * Q;
202 
203  // Get EW charges.
204  const vector<double> Bq = fEWCharges(Q);
205 
206  // Tabulate input TMDs in the impact parameter to make the
207  // integral faster.
208  const TabulateObject<Set<Distribution>> TabEvTMDs{[&] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
209  { return EvolFact(b, muf, zetaf) * TabInTMDs.Evaluate(b); }, 50, 5e-5, 30, 3, {}, TabFunc, InvTabFunc};
210 
211  const auto bintegrand = [&] (double const& b) -> double
212  {
213  // Define y integrand.
214  const Integrator yintegrand{
215  [&] (double const& ey) -> double
216  {
217  // Compute values of x1 and x2.
218  const double x1 = Q / ey / Vs;
219  const double x2 = Q * ey / Vs;
220 
221  // Get map of the TMDs in "x1" and "x2" and
222  // rotate them into the physical basis.
223  map<int,double> TMD1 = QCDEvToPhys(TabEvTMDs.EvaluateMapxQ(x1, b));
224  map<int,double> TMD2 = QCDEvToPhys(TabEvTMDs.EvaluateMapxQ(x2, b));
225 
226  // Construct the combination of TMDs weighted by
227  // the EW charges.
228  double lumi = 0;
229  for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++)
230  lumi += Bq[i-1] * ( TMD1[i] * TMD2[-i] + TMD1[-i] * TMD2[i] );
231 
232  // Divide by x1 and x2 because "EvolvedTMDPDFs"
233  // returns x times the TMD PDFs.
234  lumi /= x1 * x2 * ey ;
235 
236  return lumi;
237  }
238  };
239 
240  // Integrate in y over [ymin:ymax] or return the
241  // value if ymin = ymax.
242  if (ymin == ymax)
243  return yintegrand.integrand(exp(ymin)) * exp(ymin);
244  else
245  return yintegrand.integrate(exp(ymin), exp(ymax), IntEps);
246  };
247 
248  const double cutPref = 1 + pow(qT/Q,2) / 2;
249  const double HardFact = HardCrossSectionDY(PerturbativeOrder, Alphas(muf), NF(muf, Thresholds), cmuf);
250  return 2 * cutPref * HardFact * OgataQuadrature(bintegrand, qT);
251  }
252  };
253  // Integrate in Q over [Qmin:Qmax] or return the
254  // value if Qmin = Qmax.
255  if (Qmin == Qmax)
256  return ConvFact * FourPi * Qintegrand.integrand(log(Qmin)) / 9 / Vs / Vs / Qmin;
257  else
258  return ConvFact * FourPi * Qintegrand.integrate(log(Qmin), log(Qmax), IntEps) / 9 / Vs / Vs;
259  };
260  }

const double FourPi

◆ TmdCrossSectionSIDIS()

function<double(double const&)> apfel::TmdCrossSectionSIDIS ( double const &  Vs,
double const &  x,
double const &  y,
double const &  z,
function< Set< Distribution >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &  EvolvedTMDPDFs,
function< Set< Distribution >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &  EvolvedTMDFFs,
function< double(double const &)> const &  Alphas,
function< vector< double >(double const &)> const &  fEWCharges,
int const &  PerturbativeOrder,
vector< double > const &  Thresholds,
double const &  cmuf,
double const &  czetaf 
)

Definition at line 91 of file tmdcrosssections.cc.

103  {
104  // Compute virtuality of the photon.
105  const double Q = sqrt( x * y ) * Vs;
106 
107  // Compute "muf" and "zetaf". They are assumed to be proportional
108  // to Q and Q^2, respectively, through "cmuf" and "czetaf".
109  const double muf = cmuf * Q;
110  const double zetaf = czetaf * Q * Q;
111 
112  // Get EW charges.
113  const vector<double> Bq = fEWCharges(Q);
114 
115  // Tabulate input TMD PDFs and FFs in the impact parameter to make
116  // the integral faster.
117  const auto TabFunc = [] (double const& b) -> double{ return log(b); };
118  const auto InvTabFunc = [] (double const& fb) -> double{ return exp(fb); };
119  const TabulateObject<Set<Distribution>> TabulatedPDFs{[&] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
120  { return EvolvedTMDPDFs(b, muf, zetaf); }, 50, 5e-5, 30, 3, {}, TabFunc, InvTabFunc};
121  const TabulateObject<Set<Distribution>> TabulatedFFs{[&] (double const& b) -> Set<Distribution>
122  { return EvolvedTMDFFs(b, muf, zetaf); }, 50, 1e-2, 30, 3, {}, TabFunc, InvTabFunc};
123 
124  // Construct the TMD luminosisty in b scale to be fed to be
125  // trasformed in qT space.
126  const auto TMDLumib = [=] (double const& b) -> double
127  {
128  // Get map of the TMDs in "x1" and "x2" and rotate them into the
129  // physical basis.
130  map<int,double> PDFs = QCDEvToPhys(TabulatedPDFs.EvaluateMapxQ(x, b));
131  map<int,double> FFs = QCDEvToPhys(TabulatedFFs.EvaluateMapxQ(z, b));
132 
133  // Construct the combination of TMDs weighted by the EW
134  // charges.
135  double lumi = 0;
136  for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++)
137  lumi += Bq[i-1] * ( PDFs[i] * FFs[i] + PDFs[-i] * FFs[-i] );
138 
139  // Divide by x1 and x2 because the "EvolvedTMDPDFs" function
140  // returns x times the TMDs.
141  lumi /= x * z;
142 
143  return lumi;
144  };
145 
146  // Compute hard coefficient, including the other kinematic
147  // factors.
148  const double hcs = 2 * M_PI * HardCrossSectionSIDIS(PerturbativeOrder, Alphas(muf), NF(muf, Thresholds), muf/Q) / x / y / pow(Q,2);
149  //const double hcs = ConvFact * 2 * M_PI * HardCrossSectionSIDIS(PerturbativeOrder, Alphas(muf), NF(muf, Thresholds), muf/Q) / x / y / pow(Q,2);
150 
151  return [TMDLumib,hcs,Q] (double const& qT) -> double
152  {
153  return hcs * OgataQuadrature(TMDLumib, qT);
154  // For test purposes, one can comment out the line above, in
155  // which the Ogata quadrature is used, and comment in the two
156  // lines below to use the DGauss quadrature. The second will
157  // be substantially slower but should return consistent
158  // results.
159  //const Integrator integrand{[=] (double const& bT) -> double{ return TMDLumib(bT) * j0(qT * bT) * bT / 2; }};
160  //return hcs * cutPref * integrand.integrate(0.00005,30,eps9);
161  };
162  }

385  a[22][9]=.00000000000001;
386 
387  a[0][10]=.99343651671347;
388  a[1][10]=.02225770126826;
389  a[2][10]=.00101475574703;
390  a[3][10]=.00008175156250;
391  a[4][10]=.00000899973547;
392  a[5][10]=.00000120823987;
393  a[6][10]=.00000018616913;
394  a[7][10]=.00000003174723;
395  a[8][10]=.00000000585215;
396  a[9][10]=.00000000114739;
397  a[10][10]=.00000000023652;
398  a[11][10]=.00000000005082;
399  a[12][10]=.00000000001131;
400  a[13][10]=.00000000000259;
401  a[14][10]=.00000000000061;
402  a[15][10]=.00000000000015;
403  a[16][10]=.00000000000004;
404  a[17][10]=.00000000000001;
405 
406  if((n<1) || (n>4) || (p<1) || (p>4) || (n+p>5))
407  {
408  result=0.0;
409  printf("****CERN SUBROUTINE RESULT...ILLEGAL VALUES n=%d p=%d",n,p);
410  return(result);
411  }
412 
413  if(x==sgn[0])
414  {
415  result=s1[n][p];
416  return(result);
417  }
418 
419  if((x>fct[2]) || (x<sgn[1]))
420  {
421  x1=sgn[0]/x;
422  h=c1*x1+c2;
423  alfa=h+h;
424  v[0]=sgn[0];
425  v[1]=log(-x);
426  for(l=2;l<=n+p;l++)
427  {
428  v[l]=v[1]*v[l-1]/l;
429  }
430  sk=0.0;
431  for(k=0;k<=p-1;k++)
432  {
433  p1=p-k;
434  r=pow(x1,p1)/(fct[p1]*fct[n-1]);
435  sm=0.0;
436  for(m=0;m<=k;m++)
437  {
438  n1=n+k-m;
439  l=index[10*n1+p1-10];
440  b1=0.0;
441  b2=0.0;
442  for(i=nc[l];i>=0;i--)
443  {
444  b0=a[i][l]+alfa*b1-b2;
445  b2=b1;
446  b1=b0;
447  }
448  q=(fct[n1-1]/fct[k-m])*(b0-h*b2)*r/pow(p1,n1);
449  sm=sm+v[m]*q;
450  }
451  sk=sk+sgn[k]*sm;
452  }
453  sm=0.0;
454  for(m=0;m<=n-1;m++)
455  {
456  sm=sm+v[m]*c[n-m][p];
457  }
458 
459  result=sgn[n]*sk+sgn[p]*(sm+v[n+p]);
460  return(result);
461  }
462 
463  if(x>0.5)
464  {
465  x1=sgn[0]-x;
466  h=c1*x1+c2;
467  alfa=h+h;
468  v[0]=sgn[0];
469  u[0]=sgn[0];
470  v[1]=log(x1);
471  u[1]=log(x);
472  for(l=2;l<=p;l++)
473  {
474  v[l]=v[1]*v[l-1]/l;
475  }
476  for(l=2;l<=n;l++)
477  {
478  u[l]=u[1]*u[l-1]/l;
479  }
480  sk=0.0;
481  for(k=0;k<=n-1;k++)
482  {
483  p1=n-k;
484  r=pow(x1,p1)/fct[p1];
485  sm=0.0;
486  for(m=0;m<=p-1;m++)
487  {
488  n1=p-m;
489  l=index[10*n1+p1-10];
490  b1=0.0;
491  b2=0.0;
492  for(i=nc[l];i>=0;i--)
493  {
494  b0=a[i][l]+alfa*b1-b2;
495  b2=b1;
496  b1=b0;
497  }
498  q=sgn[m]*(b0-h*b2)*r/pow(p1,n1);
499  sm=sm+v[m]*q;
500  }
501  sk=sk+u[k]*(s1[p1][p]-sm);
502  }
503  result=sk+sgn[p]*u[n]*v[p];
504  return(result);
505  }
506 
507  l=index[10*n+p-10];
508  h=c1*x+c2;
509  alfa=h+h;
510  b1=0.0;
511  b2=0.0;
512  for(i=nc[l];i>=0;i--)
513  {
514  b0=a[i][l]+alfa*b1-b2;
515  b2=b1;
516  b1=b0;
517  }
518  result=(b0-h*b2)*pow(x,p)/(fct[p]*pow(p,n));
519  return(result);
520  }

◆ TmdCrossSectionDY

function< double(double const &)> apfel::TmdCrossSectionDY

Functions that return the fully differential Drell-Yan cross section as function of the transverse momentum on the vector boson qT, taking as inputs the evolved TMD PDFs, the center-of-mass energy Vs, the vector-boson virtuality Q and rapidity, the final TMD scales muf and zetaf.

◆ TmdCrossSectionSIDIS

function<double(double const&)> apfel::TmdCrossSectionSIDIS(double const &Vs, double const &x, double const &y, double const &z, function< Set< Distribution >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &EvolvedTMDPDFs, function< Set< Distribution >(double const &, double const &, double const &)> const &EvolvedTMDFFs, function< double(double const &)> const &Alphas, function< vector< double >(double const &)> const &fEWCharges, int const &PerturbativeOrder, vector< double > const &Thresholds, double const &cmuf=1, double const &czetaf=1)

Functions that return the fully differential SIDIS cross section as function of the transverse momentum on the vector boson qT, taking as inputs the evolved TMD PDFs and FFs, the center-of-mass energy Vs, the inelasticity y, the momentum fractions of the incmoming and outgoing hadrons x and z, rapidity, the final TMD scales muf and zetaf.
